texts.es: En el municipio de Quezalguaque departamento de león, originario de una comarca aledaña  El señor Antonio es Felizmente  Casado, de profesión Productor Agropecuario ejerce las dos actividades es un señor emprendedor, con 2 hijos   en edad escolar, a los que tiene el deber de mantener sus estudios, Desde que inicio su negocio hace 22 años El señor Antonio se esforzó por mejorar la  actividad como es la producción de leche, y convinarla con la Agricultura en pequeñas areas,   la primera  que le es rentable hoy y ocupa el primer lugar en preferencia por los resultados obtenidos en rendimientos y estabilidad, mejoramiento Genético del Ganado, y   hoy poder mantener su núcleo familiar, también convina otra actividad comercial que maneja su esposa en león , una de las necesidades es de adquirir 2 vacas de buena Raza para incrementar su inventario y producción, por eso visito a ceprodel para ser beneficiado.
texts.en:
Antonio, originally from a nearby region, lives in the town of Quezalguaque, department of León. He is happily married and makes a living as a farmer and a producer. He carries out both activities. He is an enterprising man with two school aged children, who he has to support in their studies. 

Since he started his business 22 years ago, Antonio has made an effort to improve his activity with milk production and to combine this activity with farming small areas. The former is profitable and takes up the first place in preference due to the results obtained in both yield and stability, with genetically breed cattle, with allows him to provide for his family. He also carries out another activity which his wife manages. 

He needs to buy 2 well breed cows in order to increase his stock and production, which is why he came to visit Ceprodel to receive a loan.

loans.use: to buy two calved cows.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario, de 42 años, es una mujer amable y emprendedora, esta separada y es madre de tres hijos, uno de ellos es mayor e independiente y tiene 27 años, el segundo de 5 Darcery y Richard de 1 año. Juntos viven en una casa propia en donde a diario trabaja mucho para así poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Rosario, es una mujer que no le dice no a los grandes retos, es así como al ver la gran necesidad de dinero que padecía cada mes decidió incursionar en otro trabajo sin que le perjudique el actual, que es trabajador de limpieza de su distrito. Es así que decidió por vender desayuno de manera delivery, hizo su cartera de clientes entre los que estaban sus compañeros de piso y de otras áreas de su trabajo. Hace ya 4 años comenzó a hacer este trabajo el cual lo hace con la ayuda de una señora a quien contrata.
Le esta yendo muy buen ya que tiene buenos pedidos, por ello se siente tranquila ya que a fin de mes ve sus ingresos y derivarlos al hogar. espera que le siga yendo bien y al parecer así será ya que diariamente se incrementan mas los pedidos y por tanto desea ampliar su negocio. Este será el crédito número 4 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos para seguir con su trabajo, además de comprar una extractora y una licuadora profesional.
texts.en:
Rosario, 42 years old, is a friendly and entrepreneurial woman. She is separated and has three children. One is 27 years old and is independent, the second, Darcery, is 5 years old and Richard is 1 year old. They live together in their own house where Rosario works hard daily to be able to offer a better quality of life. Rosario is a woman who does not say no to big challenges. When she saw the need for money every month she decided to venture into another job without disturbing her current one, which is as a cleaner in the area. So she decided to sell 'delivery breakfasts'. She built up her customer list amongst her flatmates and work colleagues. She started this activity four years ago and she carries it out with the contracted help of another woman.

This activity is going very well as she has good orders. She feels calm as at the end of the month she sees her income which is destined to her home. She hopes to continue doing well and she believes she will as her orders are increasing daily. She hopes to extend her business. This will be her 4th loan with MFP. She is very happy knowing she will have financial support and this gives her the tranquillity to continue with her work. With the loan of 2,000 PEN she will buy ingredients and supplies to continue with her work, as well as a blender and a professional juice extractor.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients, as well as a blender and a juicer extractor.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou, 47, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is a single parent with one child.  She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                             

Marilou operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also operates a small barber shop for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marilou hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her child a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam, 44, is a diligent mother who is in the agricultural business to generate income. She also has her husband who helps to manage all the farming process. However, this couple is able to earn a low income from rice husbandry. At the present she has been blessed with 9 children, 5 of whom are already married and live separately in Prey Chor district. 

With the funds she has requested from our lenders, Sam intends to pay for five hectare of farmland, which she’s rented from a local villager for the purpose of growing a few kinds of bean crops. This loan will sustain the family business and thereby increase her income. For her business goal, she would like to own a medium-size farmland for her bean crops someday.

loans.use: to pay for five hectare of farmland, which she's rented from a local villager.

loans.name: Adelie

texts.en:
Adelie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 8 years now.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant. In the future, Adelie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Merfelita

texts.en:
Merfelita is 59 years old and a widow with 7 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

She has borrowed and paid loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and motorcycle transport.

Merfelita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Maria Loreta

texts.en:
This is Maria Loreta, 51, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                             

She operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Maria Loreta hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Flora

texts.es:
La señora María es una mujer de 67 años, lamentablemente se dedico sola al cuidado de sus mellizas, desde que ambas tenían 3 años, debido a que su esposo falleció. Luego de atravesar por esta triste situación ella se dedico al cuidado de sus pequeñas, en ese entonces, sola. Ya ha transcurrido mucho tiempo desde aquel suceso, actualmente sus hijas son mayores de edad y con mucho esfuerzo a podido brindarles la educación que necesitaban sus pequeñas, dedicándose al comercio y a dar educación en la tarde a otros niños con la finalidad de generar ingresos.

María, es una mujer a la que le gusta mucho preparar dulces y se dedica a esta actividad en sus tiempos libres, como buena peruana es fanática de todos los platos picantes, disfruta mucho de ellos. En la actualidad ella vive en la ciudad de Mala, ubicada al sur de la capital del Perú, Lima. Mala se caracteriza por la linda y generosa población que tiene, es un pueblo pequeño y bonito.

Para poder tener ingresos, María decidió poner una librería – bazar, esta tienda lleva aperturada aproximadamente 5 años, tiempo suficiente en donde ella ha aprendido mucho sobre su negocio. Ella atiende a partir de las 6:30 de la mañana hasta las 8:30 de la noche, en ese tiempo atiende a 18 clientes en promedio, sus clientes siempre regresan y ella está segura que es por la amabilidad que tiene con sus clientes y la variedad de productos que le brinda. Como otra actividad también se dedica a la venta de “Colado”, este está hecho a base de frejoles endulzados, producto que vende semanalmente a los clientes que viven por su casa.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, María podrá realiza la compra de útiles y prendas escolares, regalos para implementar en su bazar y también para la compra de algunos insumos para la preparación del colado que vende, ella espera poder incrementar mucho sus ventas debido a las festividades que se realizan hasta el mes de Mayo. Todo este esfuerzo y visión empresarial la llevaran a incrementar la cantidad de sus productos y por ende también mejorar sus ingresos, lo mismo que le permitirá ahorrar para luego ampliar su negocio, comprar algunos exhibidores, andamios y otros. Su sueño es poder ver cómo va creciendo su negocio y también poder ver casadas a sus mellizas y puedan ser completamente felices.
texts.en:
Maria is 67 years old. Unfortunately she looked after her twin daughters alone, since they were three years old, as her husband passed away. After going through this sad situation she spent her time caring for her young children alone. A lot of time has passed since then; her children are now grown up and with a lot of hard work she has been able to give them the education that they needed. She devoted herself to trading and to providing education in the afternoons to other children with the aim of generating income.

Maria is a woman who likes to prepare sweets and she makes a living in this activity in her free time. Like a good Peruvian she is a fan of all spicy dishes and she enjoys them a lot. She currently lives in the city of Mala, located to the south of the capital of Peru, Lima. Mala is characterised by its lovely and generous inhabitants of this beautiful little town.

In order to generate income Maria decided to set up a bookshop - a bazaar. This shop has been open for approximately 5 years, long enough to have taught her a lot about her business. She tends the shop from 6:30 in the morning until 8:30 in the evening. During this time she serves an average of 18 customers. Her customers always come back and she is sure that it is because of her friendliness and the variety of products she offers. As another activity she sells "Colado", made from sweetened beans, which she sells weekly to her customers who live near her house.

With the help of Kiva's loans, Maria will be able to buy school supplies and uniforms, and gifts to stock her bazaar. She will also buy some supplies to prepare the colado that she sells. She hopes to be able to increase her sales thanks to the festivities that are celebrated until the month of May. All this effort and business vision will lead her to increase the quantity of her products and so also increase her income as well as being able to save in order to later extend her business, to buy display cabinets, scaffolding and other items. Her dream is to be able to see her business grow and to see her twin daughters married and completely happy.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, uniforms, gifts and other supplies.

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora María Lourdes es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 54 años quien desde hace 30 años empezó a vender en el mayoreo tajadas con queso y poco a poco fue creciendo hasta tener una comideria completa. Negocio con el cual saco adelante a su 6 hijos los cuales ya son mayores y están casados.
 Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de granos básicos, perecederos, carne…etc.
texts.en:
Maria Lourdes is a hard working, enterprising woman who is 54 years old. 30 years ago she started to sell cheese "tajadas". It slowly greq until she had a full food store. With this business she helped her 6 children get ahead, who have now grown up and are married.

She will invest the loan in buying basic grains, perishables, meat, etc.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, perishables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth, de 27 años, es una buena y amable mujer, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte la alegría de la vida, trabaja mucho a diario ya que lo que más desea es brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres. En la cuadra en la que vive Ruth siempre hay algunos eventos importantes en los cuales todos los de la zona participan. Los días festivos son cuando ella tiene mas ventas, pues la solicitan para que le confecciones la mayor variedad, calidad y diseño de prendas de vestir, siempre tiene un modelo nuevo que ofrecer y todas sus prendas están muy a la moda. Lleva realizando este negocio ya por seis años y lo hace sola. Durante su tiempo de trabajo en esta actividad aprendió que cuando el cliente no va en busca de las prendas, ella tiene que salir ya que no puede tener mucho tiempo su mercadería en casa. Espera seguir trabajando mucho y mas adelante poner un local en donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas asegura de avanzar con su negocio, por su parte se compromete una vez mas a seguir siendo una socia cumplida en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitad 1000 soles, comprará mercadería para seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes ya que desea renovar sus diseños para ofrecer productos a la moda.
texts.en:
Ruth, 27, is a good natured and kind woman. She is single with no children, and lives with her parents with whom she shares the joy of life. She works hard every day, and her greatest desire is to provide a better quality of life for her parents. 

In the block where Ruth lives there are always some important events going on, and everyone is the the area is involved. Her sales increase in the holidays, as she receives orders for clothing of the greatest variety, quality and design. She always has a new style to offer, and all of her clothes are very fashionable. She has had this business and for six years, and she does it alone. During her time working, she has learned that when clients are not in search of clothes, she has to leave the house because she cannot keep her garments at home for too long. 

Ruth hopes to continue working hard and in future she wants a place where she can sell her garments more comfortably. This loan will be her second with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support as she feels more assured of advancing her business. On her part, she is committed once again to remain a responsible member and comply with the payment schedule. With the requested amount of 1000 soles, Ruth will buy merchandise to continue offering to her customers, and she wants to renew her designs to offer fashionable products to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics to create more items of clothing

loans.name: Celinda María

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Celinda, tiene 52 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tuvo tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, con ella vive un nieto el cual tiene 7 años que es como su hijo y  estudia escuela.
 
Ella para salir adelante se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras y frutas, dos veces por semana ella fleta un carro en el cual recorre los campos comprando los productos  a agricultores de la zona, para luego llevarlos a entregar al mercado de mayoristas en la ciudad de Portoviejo, entrega al por mayor a comerciantes en este lugar. Ella lleva más de 15 años realizando esta actividad y es algo que realizaba junto a su esposo y ahora es su fuente de ingresos para poder subsistir.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar frutas y verduras para vender. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de 10 años y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y le ayudan mucho. 

Su sueño es tener un carro propio para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the communal bank Quiroga meets In the Quiroga parish church in the city of Calceta, where people largely make a living in agriculture, raising animals and selling it products.

In this place we met Celinda, 52 years old. Several years ago her husband passed away but from this relationship she had three children who are now adults. One seven year old grandchild lives with her and, like her son, studies at school.

To get ahead she makes a living buying and selling fruit and vegetables. Twice a week she charters a truck which travels round the fields buying products from the farmers in the area. She later takes these products to the wholesale market in the city of Portoviejo. She sells wholesale to the traders there. She has carried out this activity for more than 15 years and it is something that she did together with her husband. It is now her source of income from which she gets by.

She will use this loan to buy fruit and vegetables to resell. She has been a member of the communal bank for more than 10 years and she likes it because the loan are very quick and they help her a lot.

Her dream is to have her own truck to transport her products.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Dora Luz

texts.es: La señora Dora Luz es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene un comedor desde hace 9 años donde trabaja junto a su hija y un nieto el cual está a su cargo. Ella invertirá el crédito en arroz, frijoles, aceite, carne y pacederos (cebolla, chiltoma, tomate, zanahoria…etc.) con el firme propósito de slir adelante.
texts.en: Dora Luz is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has had a restaurant for 9 years. She works there with her daughter and a grandson that she is raising. She will invest the loan in rice, beans, oil, meat and vegetables (onions, chiles, tomatoes, carrots, etc.) with the strong purpose of getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, meat and vegetables (onion, chiles, tomatoes, carrots, etc.)

loans.name: Rita Mercedes

texts.es:
Rita, de 46 años de edad, casada, madre de tres hijos, de oficio comerciante, vende mercadería en general como ropa, zapatos, perfumes, bisuterías, lleva 12 años  dedicándose a esta actividad. La cual inicio con muy poco capital, comenzó por vender solo ropa para niño después fue introduciendo mercadería nueva. Hoy en día la mayoría de sus clientes son personas que trabajan en empresas y bancos donde aprovecha las horas de almuerzo para ir a vender dentro de esas instituciones. Ella vende su mercadería de manera ambulante y a domicilio.
Realizo el crédito para comprar faldas, camisas, pantalones, calcetines, camisetas, cuadernos, útiles escolares, para vender durante esta temporada de escuela. Uno de sus planes próximos es poner una tienda de ropa y mercadería en general.
texts.en:
Rita, 46, is married and has three children.  She is a trader who sells general merchandise, such as clothing, shoes, perfume, and costume jewellery--a business she has been conducting for the last twelve years.  She started off with very little capital, selling just children's clothing; later, she began to introduce new merchandise.  Nowadays, most of her clients are people who work in offices and banks; she takes advantage of their lunch hours to sell her wares inside these institutions, and she also goes to people's homes with her wares.

She will use this credit to buy skirts, shirts, pants, socks, t-shirts, notebooks, and school supplies to sell during the school year.  Her plan for the future is to set up a shop selling clothing and general merchandise.

loans.use: to buy skirts, shirts, pants, socks, t-shirts, notebooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es: Milagros, de 19 años, es un mujer buena, perseverante y emprendedora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene un precioso bebe de cinco meses de nacido, al ver a su hijo entre sus brazos se refleja en su rostro el deseo de salir adelante y brindarle mejores condiciones de vida. Por ahora vive en casa de sus padres y lo que mas quiere es poder ver crecer a su hijo. Milagros, tiene una trabajo muy bueno, se encarga de hacer bufets, tortas, postres, comidas y cualquier tipo de pedido para poder organizar un cumpleaños, tiene un taller en su casa en donde aprendió de una buena maestra que es su madre. Lleva realizando éste trabajo por cinco años, pero hace 2 años que se independizo y actualmente tiene sus propios pedidos. Le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene la ayuda de su conviviente con quien tiene planes de poder tener un taller en su propia casa y así tener mejores ingresos. Espera seguir trabajando y mas adelante poner una pastelería en donde pueda ofrecer su buenos productos de buen aroma, buen color y sobre todo buen sabor. Este será el préstamo número 2 con MFP, por tanto espera de este aporte para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como el préstamo anterior que demostró ser muy responsables con sus pagos. Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos para continuar con su trabajo e incrementar así su negocio, además una batidora que le hace mucha falta.
texts.en: Milagros is 19 years old. She is a good, persevering and enterprising woman. She lives with her common law spouse with whom she has a beautiful five month old baby. When she sees her son in her arms she sees reflected in his face her wish to get ahead and offer him a better quality of life. For now she lives in her parents' house and what she wants the most is to watch her son grow up. Milagros has a very good job. She does buffets, cakes, desserts, meals and any type of order for organizing birthdays. She has a workshop at her house where she learned from a good teacher, her mother. She has been doing this job for 2 years, since she went off on her own and at present she has her own orders. It is going very well for her since she has her spouse's help. She has a plan with him to to  open a workshop in their own house and thus have more income. She hopes to keep working and in the future open a pastry shop where she can offer her good products with a nice aroma, color above all, flavor. This will be loan number 2 with MFP. She hopes that with this contribution she can meet her goals. She is also committed one again to making her payments, as with the previous loan, with which she showed that she is responsible with her payments. With the amount of 1200 soles that she has asked for, she will buy ingredients and materials to continue her work, as well as to buy a mixer that she really needs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials as well as a mixer.

loans.name: Ansole

texts.en:
Ansole is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. She also earns income from a sari-sari store.

Ansole is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Ansole has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. Her dream is to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 63 years old and married with 4 children. She earns a living from a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been doing this for 3 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Loreta is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: José Leonel

texts.es:
El Señor José tiene 29 años de edad, esta casado  tiene 1 hijo de 3 meses, reside en la comunidad de Cofradía en el Municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortés.
Don José trabajaba en un taller de enderezado y pintura de Vehículos, hace 2 años por iniciativa propia y con sus propios ingresos instalo su propio taller brindando buen servicio y atención a sus clientes.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la suma de 10,000 Lempiras que piensa invertir en la compra de materia prima para el enderezado y pintura de vehículos (Pintura, Tiner, Flex).
Él espera brindar servicio de calidad a sus clientes y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio para desarrollarlo como una empresa.
texts.en:
José, age 29, is married and has a three month old child.  He lives in the Cofradía community in the San Pedro Sula municipality, Cortés.

José used to work in a paint and body shop.  Two years ago, through his own initiative and his own earnings, he set up his own workshop providing good service and attention to customers.

He has now requested a loan for 10,000 lempiras that he plans to use to buy supplies for body work and painting vehicles (paint, thinner, and primer).  

He hopes to provide his customers with quality service.  That way he will make his business grow in order to develop like a company.

loans.use: to buy supplies (paint, thinner, and primer).

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 42 years old and married with 6 children.

Alejandra works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a sari-sari store in the Philippines for 12 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Alejandra has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo and groceries, in her sari-sari store. She has borrowed and paid back 18 loans from NWTF before taking this loan. 

Alejandra aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mayra Janeth

texts.es:
Mayra Janeth, tiene 33 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos de 9, 11, 14 y 18 años de edad, vive en la Colonia 4 de enero de Tela junto a su esposo quien le apoya en el negocio.
Su negocio es venta de productos alimenticios como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, manteca, harina, lácteos, refrescos, churros, carnes, embutidos etc. el cual lo estableció hace dos años y lo atiende todo el día.
Mayra inicio con la ayuda de su esposo, quien tenía un dinero ahorrado y decidieron invertirlo para generar más ingresos.
Para mantener surtido el negocio ha solicitado tres préstamos con el actual, que es de L.13,000.00 y también lo va invertir para comprar más productos tales como: granos básicos, lácteos, carnes, embutido, harina, azúcar y refrescos.
La meta que tiene es llegar a tener un mini súper  y lograr que su hija mayor obtenga el título universitario.
texts.en:
Mayra Janeth, age 33, is married and has four children, ages 9, 11, 14, and 18.  She lives in the 4 de Enero neighborhood in Tela.  She lives with her husband; he supports her in the business.

Her business is selling food products like rice, beans, sugar, lard, flour, dairy products, soft drinks, churros, meat, and sausages, etc.  She established the business two years ago, and she tends to it all day.  Mayra started with her husband’s help.  He had some money saved, and they decided to invest it in order to generate more income.

This loan for 13,000 lempiras is the third loan she has requested in order to keep her business stocked.  She will use it to buy more products like basic grains, dairy products, meat, sausages, flour, sugar, and soft drinks.

The goal that she has is to come to have a mini supermarket and to manage for her oldest daughter to get her university degree.

loans.use: to buy more products like basic grains, dairy products, meat, sausages, flour, sugar, and soft drinks in order to stock her business.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a conservative person, and for that reason she has asked her husband Abd Alrazzaq to take her place in the picture.

Sabah is a 43-year-old housewife who has three sons and one daughter. After her husband retired they bought sheep and goats and started an animal sales business. 

Today Sabah has applied for a loan to buy feed for the animals they have.

loans.use: to buy feed for the animals they have.

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Amneh is 53 years old and a married woman. Her husband owns a small factory for making ice cream biscuits, Amneh also works in the same factory. In winter they bring in two workers to help them, but in summer the number of workers increases to cover the market needs.

Amneh has applied for a loan to work on making new types of ice cream biscuits with different tastes.

loans.use: to work on making new types of ice cream biscuits with different tastes.

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.es:
Don Hipólito tiene 53 años de edad, esta casado hace 30 años, tiene 2 hijos de 16 y 10 años de edad y los dos están estudiando, vive con su familia en una aldea rural del municipio de San José Comayagua. 
Su actividad económica es la agricultura. Inicio sus labores desde muy joven, dedicado específicamente a la producción de cultivo de café y granos básicos. El ofrece café pergamino el cual es vendido a intermediarios para su exportación. Dispone algunos terrenos los cuales ha obtenido con mucho trabajo, empeño y dedicación para la siembra de sus cultivos. Facilitándole la estabilidad familiar y sus fuentes de ingresos.
El lleva varios préstamos con ODEF. Ahora solicita su tercer préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de abono y fertilizante para la limpieza, mantenimiento de la siembra de sus cultivos y así poder sacar buenas cosechas.
Su plan es poder cultivar una manzana de café para obtener mayor producción.
texts.en:
Hipólito, age 53, has been married for 30 years.  He has two children, ages 16 and 10.  Both children attend school.  He lives with his family in a rural village in the San José Comayagua municipality.

His business is agriculture.  He started his work when he was very young.  Specifically, he devotes himself to growing coffee and basic grains.  He sells wet parchment coffee to intermediaries for exportation.  He has some land for growing crops, which he obtained with a great deal of work, determination, and dedication. This provides him with family stability and sources of income.

He has had various loans with ODEF.  He is now requesting his third loan to buy manure and fertilizer for the clearing and maintenance of the crops.  That way he will be able to have good harvests.

His plan is to be able to cultivate one “manzana” (7000 square meters) of coffee in order to get better production.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Due to cultural issues, Dalal was not willing to have her picture uploaded on the internet; the man n the photo is her brother.

Dalal is a 33-year-old single woman from Madaba, Jordan and she has a home-based project in which she produces cheese and other dairy products.

Dalal is requesting a loan of 800 JD to purchase milk for producing cheese and other dairy products with a aspiration of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase milk for producing cheese and other dairy products.

loans.name: Ne'ama

texts.en:
Ne’ama is a 39-year-old married woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Ne’ama has a home-based project; she sells antiques and is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more antiques and products for business purposes.

Ne’ama is looking to purchase a home for the family.

loans.use: to purchase antiques for business purposes.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 37-year-old married man from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan and a father of five children.

Anwar is a taxi driver and he also has a home-based project through which he sells goods and products such as clothes, blankets, etc., which provides him with an additional income  source.

Anwar is requesting a loan of 1200 JD to purchase new quantities of goods and products with an aspiration of having  a car to use for distributing these products to shops since he is currently using his taxi.

loans.use: to purchase goods and products such as clothes, blankets, perfumes, etc., for business purposes.

loans.name: Nonela

texts.en:
Nonela is 73 years old, widowed, and has five children. Nonela runs a general store in the Philippines and works hard to provide for her family. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from rice retailer.

Nonela is requesting a loan for15,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy more items to sell. Nonela has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF.  Nonela aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, 40 years old and single, works hard to provide for her family. The operator of a sari sari store in the Philippines for six years, she also earns an income from fruit and vegetable vending.

Anita has borrowed and repaid nine previous loans from NWTF and is now requesting a PHP 23000 loan to buy items including shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari sari store. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items including shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari sari store.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Forty-two-year-old Lilibeth is a married woman with four children between the ages of 9 and 22. Her husband works as a fisherman. Lilibeth supports her husband's fishing by selling his catch at the market. She also buys from other fishermen to have more fish to sell. Lilibeth also makes dried fish to sell to her community. She works hard to help provide for her family's needs and to send her children to school. 

Lilibeth has requested this loan to purchase a boat engine. She hopes for her family's fishing business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase a boat engine.

loans.name: Cloudimit

texts.en: This time Cloudimit is borrowing PHP 12,000 to fund her rug making retail business. The rug making retail business that she previously funded through NWTF and Kiva continues to provide Cloudimit and her family an increased income, which is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials needed in her rug making business.

loans.name: Federica

texts.en:
Federica works hard to support her family. She is married and has a trisikad transportation business in the Philippines.  Federica requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her trisikad business.

Federica has been in this business for two years.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her trisikad transportation business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: This time Josefina is borrowing PHP 29,500 to fund her general store business. The general store and electronic re-loading retail business that she previously funded through NWTF and Kiva continues to provide Josefina with income that is improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: This time Leonora is borrowing Php 19000 to purchase goods for her general store business. The trisikad transportation business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide Leonora and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more store goods to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: This time Melanie is borrowing Php 18000 to fund her ready-to-wear clothing business. The RTW retail business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide Melanie and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more items such as pants, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Melena

texts.en:
Melena is a 41-year-old married woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan.

Melena sells clothes, perfumes, cosmetics and much more. She has no shop and is working from her home.

Melena is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more quantities of products such as perfumes, accessories and clothes.

Melena's home-based project provides a good income source for the family which consisting of nine persons, in addition to helping with Melena’s son's education expenses.

loans.use: to purchase goods and products for business purposes such as accessories, clothes, perfume, etc.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 75 years old and a widow with seven children.

Flora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items, such as shampoo and groceries, to sell in her general store.

Flora has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Flora aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items, such as shampoo and groceries, to sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 47 years old.  She is married and has five children, one of whom attends school.  Elisa works very hard to provide for them.

Elisa runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 19,500 PHP through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.  Elisa has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items including shampoo, coffee, cream, sugar and canned goods.

In the future Elisa would like to build and expand her business in order to secure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like shampoo and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Due to cultural issues, Hana was not willing to have her picture uploaded on the internet, thus the man in the photo is her husband.

Hana is a 41-year-old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Hana is a tailor and she has a workshop at her home. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase fabrics and some other materials.

Hana is looking to have a workshop outside of her home so that she can increase her production by employing other tailors.

An aspiration of Hana's is to help her children in continuing their higher education.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and some other materials.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 36-year-old married man from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan and a father of four children.

Abdullah has a printing house which he started years ago with a smaller office for printing.

Abdullah  is looking to improve his project through purchasing some raw materials and a new printing machine, thus he is requesting a loan of 1800 JD.

An aspiration of Abdullah's is to have his printing house be the number one supplier for the local market.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed for his printing house and to purchase a new printing machine.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 45-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan.

Muna is looking to improve her family's living conditions thus she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to paint her house and purchase a new water tank.

loans.use: to paint her house and purchase a new water tank.

loans.name: Majd

texts.en:
Due to cultural issues, Majd was not willing to have her picture uploaded on the internet, thus the man  in the photo is Majd's husband; Qaher.

Majd is a 44-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of two children.

Majd is requesting a loan of 700 JD to do maintenance for her home.

Majd is looking to improve her family's living conditions and increase their living standards.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her home.

loans.name: Ma. Cecelia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecelia is 44 years old.  She is married and has seven children.  Ma. Cecelia works hard to provide for her family.  

Ma. Cecelia runs a dry goods retail business in the Philippines.  She has been running this business for 22 years and also earns an income from selling fish.  Ma. Cecelia has requested a loan of 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more dry goods like textiles and ready-to-wear clothing to sell.  She has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Ma. Cecelia aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods like textiles and ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 40 years old and has five children.She lives with her family in their rural home in Kitale in Western Kenya. Her farm has been  producing milk, maize, and vegetables for the local market for six years.

Jane is requesting her third loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 40,000 KES, which she will use to buy poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming. She is focusing on doing the business with modern skills, which she says are lacking in many farmers, in order to have an edge over them. She reiterates the market exists and needs focused exploitation. Jane also notes the challenge posed by poultry diseases, which must be overcome.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy rolls of diverse fabrics to make school uniforms.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Al and Al One Stop Shop has been in business for nearly five years. Al and his dad, Al, repair tires, do car detailing and in the summer they make New Orleans' "snoballs" (a snow cone) for customers waiting in the heat.  They employ three young men who reside in the Greater New Orleans area and have exposed these young men to the ideals of entrepreneurship, professionalism, and a stern work ethic.  Al and his dad want to take Al and Al One Stop Shop to the next level and will use the Kiva loan proceeds to purchase a tire machine, a new balancer, and a scissor lift.  Anything left over will be applied toward training, marketing, and supplies.  

Special congratulations to Al, Jr. whose wife just gave birth to a baby girl.  If you ever need tires, a great car wash or a snoball, stop in at Al and Al One Stop Shop on Earhart Boulevard in NOLA.

loans.use: To pay for a tire machine, a new balancer, and a scissor lift.

loans.name: Rocio Guadalupe

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Avance Y Desarrollo se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente en la provincia y en el Ecuador.

En este lugar  conocimos a la Señora Guadalupe, tiene 18 años  de edad, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y les  son de gran ayuda. 

Ella una joven muy trabajadora que para ayudar a sus padres realiza el crédito para invertirlo en el negocio familiar, ellos tienen un restaurante en el centro de la ciudad, allí junto a su madre preparan deliciosos platos, hasta su local dia a  dia acuden muchas personas a servirse sus deliciosos platos, el plato preferidos por sus clientes es el viche de mariscos, sus clientes las prefieren porque hacen sus platos deliciosos y saludables.
  
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos.
 
Su sueño es estudiar una carrera universitaria que no lo ha podido hacer por no contar con los recursos económicos suficientes.
texts.en:
The Avance Y Desarrollo community bank meets twice a month in Junin, a canton known for its friendly, hard-working people and for the excellent liquor that's produced here and famous everywhere in Ecuador.

Our member, Sra. Guadalupe, is 18 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents.  This is her first loan from the bank and she's happy, she says, because she received the loan quickly and it will really help her develop her business.

Guadalupe is a hard-working young woman and she will invest the loan in her family's restaurant business.  The restaurant is in the center of town.  Guadalupe and her mother make plates of delicious food there for the many people who come day after day to eat.  Her customers especially like the ceviche they make because it's both delicious and healthy.  

Guadalupe will use this loan to buy supplies for her restaurant business.

Her goal is to go on to college, something that she hasn't been able to do because she doesn't have the money for it.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol.  She is 43 years old, married and has seven children.  The oldest child is 27 years old and her youngest is 10 years old.  Mercedita works hard to send her children to school.

Mercedita has been growing and selling rice for 10 years.  She earns about 3,500 PHP per month through her work farming rice.  She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor.  In the future, Mercedita hopes to increase her income and have her children finish college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Cendirella

texts.en:
Cendirella is a 36-year-old, married mother of four children. She is living in Macabayao, Jimenez, Mis. Occ., Philippines, where her wide array of banana & eggplant production is located. She has been cultivating this land since she was 32 years of age until the present time. She normally receives PHP 2,500 a month.

 In 2010, Cendirella joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure to increase production. When the crop gets realized, the revenue from it will be allotted to expanding the business area to earn more income and to cover her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure to increase production.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
This is Myrna, 59, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Amador, her business partner, and a mother to her child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                             

Myrna operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Myrna hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia is 64 years old, married, and has six adult children.  She is from Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Artemia raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Artemia has been engaged in her business for 11 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Artemia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Artemia is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure.

loans.name: Betania Liset

texts.es: Betania, de oficio comerciante, originaria de la comarca Telica ubicada en el departamento de León , ella vende ropa y es dueña de una pulpería. Nos cuenta que el primer préstamo Kiva represento un cambio muy positivo en su negocio, le permitió comprar mas mercadería, atender la necesidades de sus clientes. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo. Ahora requiere un segundo crédito para comprar artículos escolares, granos básicos, sopas, jugos , productos de limpieza. Pues desea incrementar su inventario para ofrecer mas variedad de producto y llegar a convertir su pulpería en una gran distribuidora que una de sus metas que desea realizar.
texts.en:
Betania is a shopkeeper, originally from Telica, situated in the department of León. She sells clothing and is the owner of a general store. She tells us that the 1st Kiva loan she received made a very positive change in her business. She was able to buy merchandise and attend to the needs of her clients.
She’s very grateful for the support. Now she is requesting a 2nd loan to buy school supplies, basic grains, soups, juices and cleaning products. She wants to increase her inventory to offer a bigger variety of products. One of the goals she’d like to realize is to eventually convert her general store into a big distribution centre.

loans.use: buy school supplies, basic grains, soups, juices and cleaning products.

loans.name: Jesulome Group

texts.fr: Le groupement JESULOME est composé de vingt trois personnes qui résident dans le même village et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Julienne est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Julienne n'a jamais fréquenté l’école. Julienne est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Adjaï. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Julienne et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les diverses de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Julienne vend depuis vingt ans des boissons locales faites à base du vin de palme dans une ville du Bénin. De façon secondaire, Julienne vend des bananes et du maïs. Julienne s'approvisionne dans sa région. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Julienne et les autres membres du groupement JESULOME sollicitent un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d'accroître le niveau de leur activité.Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The  JESULOME group is made up of twenty-three people who all live in the same village and belong to the same savings group. The group's leader, Julienne, has her hand raised in the photo. With the goal of increasing their activity to better meet demand from customers, the group is asking for financial support from ALIDé for the second time. 

Julienne has never been to school. She is 46 years old and married to a grower called Adjaï. The couple has six children, who have all been able to go to school and for whom they are responsible. Besides their own children, the couple cares for one other child.  Julienne and her husband live with their children and meet the various household expenses together. To meet her family's needs, for the last twenty years Julienne has been selling drinks, made from palm wine, in a town in Benin. She also sells bananas and corn. Julienne obtains her supplies locally. 

In order to increase their activity and better satisfy their customers, the members of JESULOME are asking ALIDé for a second loan. Their goal is is to expand their activity. The first loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy palm wine, corn, and bananas.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
This is Rosalinda.  She is 39 years old and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Augusto, her business partner, and a mother to her child.  Together with her husband, she manages the household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                             

Rosalinda operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages in small quantities to people in the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil or a single egg.  She earns money by acquiring supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece.  Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory.  She expects an increase in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rosalinda hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future by working hard on her business.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Emelio

texts.en:
Emelio is 52 years old and single.  He is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Emelio operates a variety (general) store. He manages his own household while operating the business. He works hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

 In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, some cooking oil, or an egg.  Emelio gets his supplies at wholesale prices and sells by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 350 PHP a day.

Emelio is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which he  will use to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Emelio meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work  and study God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary, de 45 años, es una buena mujer y muy responsable, es madre soltera de un niño de 2 años a quien cría brindándole mucho amor y protección. Ella vive en su casa propia a lado de dos hermanas a quienes le ofrece  acogida en su hogar. El trabajo de Mary consiste en el corte y confección de prendas de vestir, tiene un taller en su casa en donde lleva realizando este trabajo por 15 años, todo lo que sabe lo aprendió cuando desde joven, pues trabajaba como empleada en casa de una señora que se dedicaba a la costura, y poco a poco fue aprendiendo. Con el tiempo se independizo y desde entonces genera sus propios ingresos. Durante el tiempo que esta dedicada a esta actividad ha visto la manera de acomodarse sola ya que no puede contratar por el momento a alguien que le ayude. Tiene planes de expansión para su actividad pero sabe que el camino para lograrlo es largo y por el momento desea mantenerlo como un plan a largo plazo, ahora se preparara para empezar a confeccionar sus propios diseños y venderlos, ya que tiene pedidos de sus clientes. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por su parte ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado 800 soles, comprará materiales y herramientas para continuar con su trabajo, entre las cosas que comprará serán telas, agujas de maquinas, hijos, elásticos y mas materiales para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Mary, 45, is a good and very responsible woman.  She is the single mother of a two-year-old child whom she raises with a lot of love and protection.  She lives in her own house along with two sisters, whom she welcomes into her home.

Mary's job consists of dressmaking.  She has a workshop in her house in which she has done this work for 15 years.  She learned everything she knows when she was young, because she worked as the employee in the house of a woman who worked as a seamstress, and little by little she learned.  In time she became independent and since then she has been generating her own income.  During the time she has done this work she has seen how to adapt to being alone because at the moment she is not able to hire anyone to help her.

She has plans to expand her work but she knows that the road to achieve them is long, and for the time being she wants to keep it as a long-term plan.  Now she is getting ready to begin to make and sell her own designs because she has requests from her customers.

This will be her second loan with MFP, for which she hopes for your collaboration to continue with her goals.  For her part, she promises to make her payments on time.

With the requested loan of 800 PEN she will buy materials and tools to continue with her work.  Among the things she will buy are fabric, machine needles, thread, elastic, and more, to continue with her job.

loans.use: to buy fabric, machine needles, thread, and elastic.

loans.name: Nonvignon 4 Group

texts.fr: NONVIGNON 4 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. Le représentant du groupe, Eugène Singhor (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgé de 52 ans. Eugène Singhor est marié à une certaine Jeanne. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés dont deux restent à leur charge. Eugène Singhor vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses deux enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Eugène Singhor a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges,  Eugène Singhor vend depuis six ans, des vêtements qu'il court lui même dans son quartier. Eugène Singhor s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d'élargir son activité, Eugène Singhor sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble  avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON 4. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Nonvignon 4 is a group composed of three people residing in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, Eugène Singhor (raising his hand in the photo) is 52 years old. Eugène Singhor is married to Jeanne. They have three children, all in school, two of whom are still dependent. Eugène Singhor lives with his wife and two [younger] children. The couple jointly provide for various household needs. Eugène Singhor received primary education. In order to meet his expenses, for the last six years he has been selling  clothing made by himself, in his neigborhood.  Eugène Singhor stocks up at a market in Benin. With the goal of meeting customer demand and expanding his business, Eugène Singhor, together with the other members of the Nonvignon 4 group, is seeking his third loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow the group members to better meet demand and increase their profits. The two prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabric for sewing clothes as well as sewing supplies.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
23-year-old Alona is a married woman with 2 children aged 1 and 4. Alona and her husband run a fishing business in Trinidad, Bohol.  Alona's husband operates their fishing boat and is the one who goes out fishing, while Alona sells her husband's catch at the market.  She does her best to improve their business and take care of her children. She applied for a loan to purchase a fishing boat.  This will help expand their business.

In the future, Alona hopes to have a better quality of life. She also hopes for her children to finish college and be successful.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Glenda Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora Glenda, tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene 4 hijos (2 mujeres y 2 barones) de las edades de: 16, 13 y 10 años y el menor de 18 meses, reside en zona urbana del Municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortés.
Desde que el esposo falleció,  Doña Glenda ha tenido la responsabilidad de criar sola a sus hijos, por lo que se dedica a costurar, confeccionando cameras y cortinas y además a la venta de camisas, blusas y ropa para niños.
Glenda ha solicitado un préstamo por la suma de 20,000 Lempiras para la compra de materia prima para la confección de cameras y cortinas (telas e hilos).
Ella distribuye los pedidos a sus clientes y espera ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios y tener activa su línea de Crédito para mantener su negocio surtido.
texts.en:
Glenda, age 31, is single because she is a widow.  She has four children (two girls and two boys), ages 16, 13, 10 and 18 months.  She lives in an urban area in the San Pedro Sula municipality, Cortés.

Ever since her husband died, Glenda has had the responsibility for raising her children alone.  That is why she decided to sew.  She makes bed linens and curtains in addition to selling shirts, blouses, and children’s clothes.

Glenda has requested a loan for 20,000 lempiras to buy materials to make bed linens and curtains (fabric and thread).  She delivers her customers’ orders to them.

She hopes to help her children with their education and to have an active line of credit in order to keep her business stocked.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Graciela Margarita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Avance Y Desarrollo se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente en la provincia y en el Ecuador.

La señora Graciela, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 9 hijos, 6 mayores de edad y tres de 17, 15 y 12 años los mismos que estudian en universidad y colegio y son los que aun viven con ella. Su esposo es agricultor y chofer.

Ella como buena esposa realiza el crédito para el negocio de su esposo el cual se dedica a la agricultura, en la temporada invernal siembra maíz, maní y ciertas verduras, él también tiene un bus de una cooperativa intercantonal en el cual trabaja tres días a la semana y que el resto de los días sus hijos se hacen cargo de  trabajar en el bus ya que él tiene que dedicarse a sus cultivos, el cual lo realiza con dos a tres personas a quienes les paga un sueldo semanal por su trabajo, lleva dedicado toda la vida a esta actividad ya que desde pequeño él trabajaba junto a su papá.
  
Este crédito es para comprar ciertos insumos y fertilizantes agrícolas para tener una buena cosecha. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es terminar de pagar el bus ya que recién hace poco lo compraron y aun lo están pagando.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Avance y Desarrollo” (Advancement and Development) reunites every 15 days in the canton of Junín. This area is known for its hard-working, kind people and because in this area is distilled the best “aguardiente” (liquor) in the province and in Ecuador.  

Graciela, 54, is a married mother of 9 children, 6 of the age of maturity and 3 who are 17, 15 and 12. They’re in school and university and still live with her. Her husband is a farmer and chauffeur.

As a good wife, she is requesting the loan for her husband’s business. His line of work is agriculture and in the winter, he plants corn, peanuts and some vegetables. He also drives an inter-cantonal bus for 3 days a week, and the rest of the week, his children take over driving the bus so he can attend to his crops. He hires 2 to 3 people to help him with his crops, and pays each a weekly salary. He’s been doing this line of work his whole life and started working as a child, alongside his father. 

This loan will be invested in supplies and fertilizers to grow an abundant crop. This is her 4th loan with the Communal bank and she’s pleased with the help she receives with the loans.

Her dream is to finish paying for the bus that they bought recently and are still paying for.

loans.use: buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lourdes Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Avance Y Desarrollo se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente en la provincia y en el Ecuador.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lourdes, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos, tres de ellos mayores de edad y el menor de  16 años que estudian en colegio, dos de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende productos Yanbal y Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella sale a recorrer tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas diarias, también vende en su casa donde tiene un pequeño bar en el cual vende jugos y batidos de fruta, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, jugos, sodas y frutas. Lleva 9 años  en el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera del grupo y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. 

Su sueño es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The Avance Y Desarrollo community bank meets twice a month in Junin, a canton known for its friendly, hard-working people and the excellent liquor that's produced here and famous everywhere in Ecuador.

Our member, Lourdes, is 45 years old.  She is married and has 4 children, three of whom are grown.  Her youngest child is 16 years old and still in school.  Her husband works as a driver.  Lourdes is a full-time housewife and operates part-time businesses to help out with family expenses.  She sells Yanbal and Esika products--cosmetics, perfumes and other beauty products--three days a week, for two or three hours each day.  She sells on credit and collects from her customers every eight days.  She also operates a small juice bar in her house where she sells juices and other fruit drinks.  She has operated businesses for 12 years and says that she is happy with her progress.  

Lourdes will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, juices, soft drinks and fruit.  She has been a member of her community bank for 9 years and serves as the group's treasurer.  She likes that the bank can delivery loans quickly.

Her goal is to have a shop of her own.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail businesses.

loans.name: Mariela Maria

texts.es: Mariela tiene33 años de edad , casada, con 2 hijos uno de 7 años y 2 años el mayor va a la escuela  su 1er negocio fue tortillería desde los 17 años comenzó con esta actividad  luego poco fue poniendo su pulpería que actualmente es su negocio su esposo la apoya , comercializa su producto en su comunidad no tiene otros ingresos la expectativa q siempre ha tenido es de crecer ampliar su negocio tener de toda mercadería. Solicita el préstamo para compras productos de librería uniformes, útiles escolares y  productos de limpieza, granos básicos, pan, leche, huevo, verduras para abastecer la pulpería y sus clientes se sientan que en su negocio pueden encontrar productos de mucha necesidades.
texts.en:
Maria is 33 years old, married with two sons, ages 7 and 2 years old. The older attends school.  She started her first business, making tortillas, 17 years ago. Then she gradually established her current business, a small store. Her husband supports her in this endeavor. She sells her products in her community and does not have other income.

Maria has always hoped to grow by expanding her business to include all kinds of merchandise. She is requesting this loan to buy bookstore products, uniforms and school supplies as well as cleaning items, basic grains, bread, milk, eggs and vegetables. She wants to stock her store so that her customers will feel that they will find much needed products there.

loans.use: to buy bookstore products, uniforms, school supplies, as well as cleaning items, basic grains, bread, milk, eggs and vegetables.

loans.name: Flor Alejandrina

texts.es:
Flor, tiene experiencia con el trabajo de los créditos, pues lleva un buen record, trabajando con la institución, en este caso está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de gaseosas, arroz, pollo, embutidos, papel higiénico, entre otros que son muy necesarios en su negocio.
Ella está contenta, pues son varios ya sus créditos que le han permitido mejorar el negocio y dejarle una buena experiencia.
texts.en:
Flor has experience working with past loans and she has a good record, working with this institution. In the present case, she is requesting a new loan to buy soft drinks, rice, chicken, sausages, and toilet paper, among other items, which are very necessary for her business.

Flor is confident because she has already used various loans that have allowed her to improve her business and they have left her with a good experience.

loans.use: buy soft drinks, rice, chicken, sausages, and toilet paper to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 44 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a married woman and mother of 4 children. Gina has been raising pigs for sale for 3 years.  She earns PHP 2,000 every month for doing this business.  Gina requested a loan of PHP 4,000 from GDMPC to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  Gina has been a member of GDMPC for 3 years. In the future, Gina hopes to have a large-scale piggery in her town.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Alvin

texts.en:
Alvin is a fisherman from Trinidad, Bohol. He is 42 years old, married with 2 children aged 9 and 8.

Alvin has been a fisherman for 20 years.  He is able to provide for his family through his business.  Alvin works hard to improve his business and sustain his family, especially his children's education.  He requested a loan to purchase a fishing boat. This will help Alvin expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Wilber

texts.en: Wilber is a 34-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house. He has been a farmer for the last 10 years. After starting with one acre, he has increased to two acres. His major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, seasonal weather, and theft. However, he has a goal of buying land to grow crops and hiring employees to help expand his farm. Wilber needs a loan to rehabilitate his banana plantation.

loans.use: to rehabilitate his banana plantation

loans.name: Rebeca Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rebeca lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Rebeca quien se dedica al comercio de ropa, frijoles, zapatos desde hace 10 años. Ella inicio en adim con un préstamo muy pequeño y poco a poco su negocio ha ido creciendo su negocio.
Ella tiene dos hijos uno de 27 años el cual es una persona con capacidades diferentes y un menor de 9 años. Su meta es componer su casa lo cual ha ido logrando poco a poco. Con el crédito anterior con las ganancias pudo arreglar el techo.
Los otros integrantes son María Auxiliadora  quien se dedica a la venta de nacatamales, verduras, frutas y granos básicos; y Leonel de 53 años quien tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
The Rebeca group is comprised of three hard-working and enterprising people.  Rebeca is one of them.  She has been selling clothes, beans, and shoes for ten years.  She started with a very small loan from ADIM.  Little by little her business has been growing.

She has two children.  One is 27 years old, and he is disabled.  Her younger child is 9 years old.

Her goal is to fix her house, which she has been doing little by little.  With the previous loan and her earnings she was able to fix the roof.

Another member is  María Auxiliadora, who sells “nacatamales” (a traditional Central-American dish wrapped in leaves and steamed), vegetables, fruits, and basic grains.  The third member is 53 year old Leonel; he has a grocery store.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Rebeca Rosalina from  Nicaragua

loans.use: to buy merchandise like clothes, beans, and shoes.

loans.name: Scarleth Vanessa

texts.es: Scarleth , de 26 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de León,  tiene dos hijos, es  casada comerciante ,  se dedica a la venta de  ropa para niños y adultos , tiene 4 años de tener este negocio, ende de manera ambulante  su expectativa es llegar a poner una gran tienda de ropa  surtida. Solicito el préstamo para compra de mercadería invertir en ropa pues le va ayudar a crecer y comprar mas pacas de ropa su  meta principal es agrandar el negocio invirtiendo en ropa variada diferentes pacas comprar al por mayor para tener mejor ganancia es una mujer luchadora con visión de crecimiento en el negocio siempre buscando la manera de salir adelante par darle un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Scarleth, 26 years old, lives in the city of León. She is married with two children. She is a merchant and has been selling clothing for children and adults for 4 years. She is a street vendor with the hope of establishing a large clothing store in the future.

Scarleth requested this loan to purchase clothing merchandise, which will help her grow. She will buy more bundles of clothing. Her principal goal is to expand her business by investing in an assortment of different bundles of clothing and buying them wholesale so she will have a greater profit. She is a hardworking woman with a vision of a growing business.  She is always looking for a way to get ahead in order to provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
Mateo, ha tenido una buena experiencia con los prestamos, por eso se encuentra solicitando nuevamente, ya que considera que es una buena forma para trabajar e irse superando, en esta ocasión el préstamo será utilizado en el pago de mozos para la recolección de la cosecha de maicillo, tambien alquilara una maquina desgranadora y pago de transporte para hacerlo llegar hasta su vivienda.
