Generosa is forty-nine years old. She lives in Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. 

Generosa owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for two years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more fruits to sell. 

In 2011, Generosa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She hopes for positive business improvements.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Celia María

texts.es:
La Señora. Celia es socia del banco comunal Damas Responsables, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador", es la ciudad cultural del país. Su bello paisaje urbanístico mantiene armonía con el entorno geográfico. Su centro histórico es el más grande y el mejor conservado del país  guarda encantadoramente las claves del pasado, allí se mezclan la gente, las flores, las artesanías: tejidos, bordados, cerámica, orfebrería, platería y sombreros de paja toquilla.
 
Doña Celia tiene 72 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 11 hijos todos son mayores de edad, 6 de ellos son casados y viven  independientes, sus 5 hijos solteros trabajan para sus gastos personales. Su esposo pasa en casa ya que es jubilado, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad siendo el fruto del trabajo conyugal.

La Señora. Celia se dedica  los quehaceres de su hogar y a criar vacas, cuyes y gallinas las que las vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. También elabora  sombreros de paja toquilla, esta actividad aprendió desde que tenía 18 años de edad.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 10 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y gallinas para continuar con la cría de los mismos. 

Su sueño es viajar a New York.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of Damas Responsables Communal Bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known as the Athens of Ecuador.  It is the cultural city of the country.  Its beautiful urban landscape is harmonious with the geographic environment.  Its historic center is the biggest and best preserved in the country.  Charmingly, it keeps the keys to the past.  There, people and flowers and handicrafts mingle: textiles, embroidery, ceramics, goldsmithing, silversmithing, and hats of toquilla fiber [panama hats].

Celia, 72, is married, and from this union has conceived 11 children, all of whom are of age.  Six of them are married and live independently.  Her five single children work for their personal expenses.  Her husband stays at home because he is retired.  The house in which they live is their own property, the fruit of their labor as a couple.

Celia works in the home and raising cows, guinea pigs, and chickens, which she sells when she has some financial need.  She also makes panama hats, work she learned when she was 18 years old.

She has been a member of the communal bank for ten years.  She is going to invest her new loan in buying guinea pigs and chickens to continue raising them.

Her dream is to travel to New York.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Flor Ermencia

texts.es:
La Señora. Flor es socia del banco comunal Vegaspamba, viven por el sector que lleva el mismo nombre en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar que tiene exuberante vegetación y hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a laa artesanías y a la agricultura, se caracterizan por ser muy trabajadoras.

Doña Flor tiene 36 años, está separada de su esposo pero de su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos de 19, 15, 12, 11, 10, 8 y 5 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive  independiente, su segunda hija está estudiando en el colegio y tres de sus hijos están en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es arrendada.

La Señora Flor labora en un negocio de verduras, vende los productos que cosecha de sus sembríos y también compra a otros productores, tiene un puesto en un mercado de la ciudad y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. También cría ganado y cuyes.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su séptimo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de verduras para su negocio. 

Su meta es  agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Flor is a member of the 'Vegaspamba' community bank.  She lives in Vegaspamba district, in the city of Cuenca.  This is a place of abundant vegetation and beautiful scenery.  The locals raise animals, make handicrafts and farm.  They are noted for being very hard-working.

Flor is 36 years old and separated from her husband.  However, she has seven children from her marriage who are 19, 15, 12, 11, 10, 8 and 5 years old.  Her eldest daughter is married and lives independently.  Her second daughter is in high school and three of her other children are attending an elementary school in the city.  The house in which she lives is rented.

Flor is in the vegetable business.  She sells the produce that she harvests and also buys from other producers.  She has a stall in one of the city markets and she works from Sunday to Sunday.  She does not work fixed hours.  In addition, she also raises livestock and guinea pigs.

This is Flor's seventh loan cycle as a member of her community bank and she will invest her money in buying vegetables for her business.  Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: María Inés

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Vegaspamba, viven por el sector que lleva el mismo nombre en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar que tiene exuberante vegetación y hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a las artesanías y a la agricultura, se caracterizan por ser muy trabajadoras.

Doña María tiene 60 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 9 hijos todos son mayores de edad, ocho de ellos son casados y viven independientes, una de sus hijas es madre soltera y es quien vive en su casa con dos nietos y comparten los gastos del hogar. Su esposo labora en la agricultura, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa en casa cría ganado, cerdos, cuyes y gallinas. También siembra hortalizas para la venta y para el consumo de su hogar. Elabora sogas hace 20 años, aprendió este oficio de su mamá.

Es  socia fundadora del banco comunal, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para sus animales y semillas para sus huertos.
 
Su sueño es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Vegaspamba community bank.  She lives in Vegaspamba district, in the city of Cuenca.  This is a place of abundant vegetation and beautiful scenery.  The locals raise animals, make handicrafts and farm.  They are noted for being very hard-working.

María is 60 years old.  She is married and has nine adult children.  Eight of her children are married and live independently.  One of her daughters is a single mother and lives at home with María's two grandchildren.  They share household expenses.  María's husband works in agriculture.  They do not own their own home but rent instead.

María takes care of her housework and, as she is at home, she raises cattle, pigs, guinea pigs and hens.  In addition she sows vegetables, some of which she sells and some of which her household consumes.  She has also been making rope for 20 years.  She learned the trade from her mom.

María is a founding member of her community bank.  She will invest her new loan in buying feed for her animals and seeds for her vegetable gardens.

María's dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and seeds

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more items like pants, blouses, and other clothing for her clothing sales business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 4 years. Elizabeth earns additional income from a variety store.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, blouses, and other clothing.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 63 years old and a widow with 9 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Alicia is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Alicia has been farming rice for 40 years and also earns additional income from food vending and pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
As a married parent of 7 children, Carmela works hard to support her family.

She has a dress shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from the buying and selling of rice. Carmela is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her dress shop business.

Carmela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Phoebi

texts.en:
Phoebi is 59 years old and supports her two children ages 18 and 16 years respectively. She owns a retail shop where she has been doing business for six years now and earns a monthly income of KES.15,000.

Phoebi has requested for a loan of KES.30,000 to help her stock her shop. This is her first loan. The anticipated profit from her business will help her educate her children.  She hopes to expand her business to greater levels.

loans.use: To purchase bags of sugar, rice, bar soap and cooking fat.

loans.name: Yolita

texts.en:
Yolita is 60 years old and a widow with ten children. With 1 child in school, Yolita works very hard to provide for them.

Yolita runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested  a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Yolita has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Yolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is sixty years old. She is a widow with six children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Cecelia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise.

Cecelia has been raising livestock for three years and also earns additional income from tailoring.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Barnaba

texts.en:
Barnaba is forty years of age, married, and blessed with six children aged sixteen, fourteen, twelve, ten, eight and six. He owns a posho mill which has existed for the past two years and gives him a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He is requesting a loan of KES 22,000 to buy bags of maize for sale in his posho mill. Profit from his business will help him expand his business.

This is his third loan. His dream is to educate his children and put much effort into his business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize for sale in his posho mill.

loans.name: Lus María

texts.es:
La Señora. Lus es socia del banco comunal Vegaspamba, viven por el sector que lleva el mismo nombre en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar que tiene exuberante vegetación y hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la artesanías y a la agricultura, se caracterizan por ser muy trabajadoras.

La Señora Lus tiene 41 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 9 hijos, sus cuatro primeros hijos son mayores de edad, trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, sus cinco hijos menores tienen 9, 8, 6, 2 años  y su ultimo hijo tiene 4 meses de edad, tres  estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Doña Lus se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, a cuidar a sus hijos y en la agricultura, lo que cosecha es solo para su consumo. También se dedica a la elaboración de sogas, esta actividad aprendió de sus padres.

Es socia fundadora del banco comunal, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de piola para la elaboración de sogas.

Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Lus is  member of the "Vegaspamba" communal bank. The members live in the area of same name, in the city of Cuenca. This is a place with lush vegetation and beautiful scenery. The people raise livestock, do crafts, and farm. They are noted for being very hard-working. 

Lus is 41, married, and has nine children. Her first four children are adults, who work, and help her financially. Her five younger children are 9, 8, 6, and 2, and her youngest child is 4 months old. Three go to a small school in the city. 

Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer. They own their own home. Lus does the household chores, looks after the cildren, and farms. What she harvests is just for her own consumption. She also makes rope. She learned this occupation from her parents. 

She is a founding member of the communal bank. She is going to invest her new loan in the purchase of twine for making rope. Her goal is to finish building her house.

loans.use: Comprar piola.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is thirty-one years old and married with two children currently going to school. Connie works very hard to provide for them.

Connie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her general store.

Connie has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, bread, biscuits, soft drinks, canned goods, etc. 

In the future Connie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her general store.

loans.name: Baid

texts.en:
Baid is a married woman with two children. Baid is forty-six years old, and resides at Panduma, Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Baid owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for ten years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 from the business. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offering. 

In 2008, Baid joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Baid wants to build a house and to support her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба- женщина 44 лет, замужем имеет двоих детей. Уже десять лет , как она занимается продажей женских головных косынок и шарфов. Раньше ей привозила товар её сестра. а сейчас она ездит сама два раза в месяц в Истаравшан.Её ассортимент товаров очень разнообразный , поэтому её реализация стабильная и рентабельная. Она имеет своих постоянных клиентов, которые заказывают ей новинки товаров. Махбуба планирует на полученный кредит привезти весенний ассортимент косынок новых видов. Махбуба отлично соблюдает все условия организации и целенаправленно использует каждый свой кредит.
texts.en: Mahbuba is a 44 year-old woman, who is married and has two children.  She has been involved in selling women's scarves.  Her sister previously delivered the merchandise, but now Mahbuba herself travels to Istaravshan twice per month.  She has a wide goods selection, and this is why her sales are stable and efficient.  She has regular customers, who order the latest merchandise from her.  Mahbuba plans to use this loan to bring in a spring assortment of new types of scarves.  Mahbuba meets all organization conditions well and uses each of her loans purposefully.

loans.use: to buy a spring assortment of women's scarves

loans.name: Ana Gabriela

texts.es:
La Señora Ana es socia del banco comunal Gualaceñitas,  vive en el Cantón de Gualaceo que es un pueblo próspero, asentado en uno de los más bellos valles de la provincia y del país, espléndidos paisajes y agradable clima, por lo que constituye uno de los centros turísticos de primer orden. Sus habitantes cultivan verduras, legumbres, maíz, caña de azúcar, frutas, etc. También se dedican a crear preciosas artesanías. El centro tradicional, aunque pequeño, conserva aún casas de estilo colonial, con los típicos portales y segundos pisos sobre pilares, amplios balcones sobre todo las de la calle Cuenca, frente al parque Central.
 
La Señora Ana tiene 19 años, se encuentra viviendo en unión libre y ha concebido un hijo de 1año y cuatro meses. Su esposo ha migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo  para ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando conjuntamente con su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.

Ella trabaja desde su casa en la fabricación de calzado, actividad en la que se encuentra 5 años, labora de la lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, su trabajo lo realiza solo bajo pedidos. También está estudiando el quinto año de bachillerato.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir para la compra de hilo y pegamento para realzar su trabajo.
 
Su meta es  continuar con sus estudios y realizar los estudios Universitarios.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Gualaceñitas community bank.  She lives in Gualaceo canton, in a prosperous village, situated in one of the most beautiful valleys in the province and the country.  The area has wonderful scenery and a pleasant climate.  For this reason, it is a popular tourist destination.  The locals grow vegetables, corn, sugarcane, fruit etc.  They also create precious handicrafts.  The traditional village center, although small, still preserves some colonial-style houses with typical doorways, second floors supported on pillars, and wide balconies, especially those which are found on Cuenca Street, opposite the Central Park.

Ana is 19 years old.  She has a common-law husband and a 16-month-old son.  Her husband has migrated in search of a better job so that he can provide his family with a better future.  Ana does not own her own home but instead rents a house together with her mom.  They share the household expenses.

Ana works from home making footwear.  She has been in this business for five years.  She works from Monday to Saturday, from 8.00am to 6.00pm.  She works to order.  She is also studying her fifth year of her 'bachillerato' (High School Diploma).  This is her second loan through her community bank.  She will invest it in buying thread and adhesive so that she can carry out her work.

Ana's goal is to continue with her studies and to go on to University.

loans.use: to buy thread and adhesive

loans.name: Christabel

texts.en:
Christabel is twenty-nine years old, married, with two children. She sells fruits and vegetables to earn a living. She has been in the business for one year and describes her business environment as busy because she is visited regularly by her customers. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya,she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 15,000 Kenya Shillings to buy bananas, mangoes and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy bananas, mangoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Oda Luisa

texts.es: Luisa es social del Banco Comunal Renacer, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre de 1 hijo, es casada, se dedica a la venta de artesanías gracias a los préstamos recibidos en Finca Perú le ayudaron a mejorar su negocio, también aprendió a distribuir su ganancia y ahorros, el cual transmite a su hijo para que lo ponga en práctica, se retiró por motivos de viaje y reingresó a su Banco Comunal con el cual ya tiene 1 año, le gusta la facilidad en los préstamos que se les da y los bajos interese también le gusta por que le apoyan moralmente; el préstamo que ahora solicita lo invertirá en su negocio en la compra de productos como cerámicas, tejidos, piedra de huamanga, para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the Renacer communal bank. She is 46 years old, is married, and has one child.  She sells crafts, and thanks to the loans she has received through Finca Perú she has been able to improve her business.

She has also learned to share her profit and savings with her child, so he can put it to use.  She had previously moved away for reasons related to travel and rejoined the communal bank one year ago.

She likes the ease of using these loans and the low rates of interest.  She also appreciates the moral support.  The loan she is seeking will be invested in her business; she will purchase products such as ceramics, yarn, and alabaster stones to supply her business.

loans.use: to buy ceramics, yarn and alabaster stones.

loans.name: Tania Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora. Tania es socia del banco comunal Gualaceñitas,  vive en el Cantón de Gualaceo que es un pueblo próspero, asentado en uno de los más bellos valles de la provincia y del país, espléndidos paisajes y agradable clima, por lo que constituye uno de los centros turísticos de primer orden. Sus habitantes cultivan verduras, legumbres, maíz, caña de azúcar, frutas, etc. También se dedican a crear preciosas artesanías. El centro tradicional, aunque pequeño, conserva aún casas de estilo colonial, con los típicos portales y segundos pisos sobre pilares, amplios balcones; sobre todo, las de la calle Cuenca, frente al parque Central.
 
La Señora. Tania tiene 20 años, vive en unión libre y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 2 hijos, uno de 4 años y un bebé de 1 mes de nacido. Su esposo trabaja en el área de la construcción laborando como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Tania se dedica a la cría de pollos a los que luego los vende pelados, también compra pollos para vender, trabaja en esta actividad hace 8 años y tiene sus clientes fijos. También vende cosméticos de diferentes marcas y en este negocio esta hace 3 años.

 En el banco comunal se encuentra en su cuarto crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y cosméticos para continuar con sus negocios.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Tania is a member of Gualaceñitas Communal Bank.  She lives in Gualaceo Canton, which is a prosperous town located in one of the most beautiful valleys in the province and in the country.  Splendid landscapes and a pleasant climate make it one of the highest order of tourism centers.

The residents there grow vegetables, legumes, corn, sugar cane, fruit, etc.  They also work making beautiful handicrafts.  The traditional center, although small, still preserves colonial-style houses with typical doorways and second floors on columns and spacious balconies, especially those on Cuenca Street, across from Central Park.
 
Tania, 20, lives in a common-law relationship and has conceived two children, ages 4 and one month, from this union.  Her husband works in the field of construction as a bricklayer.  She does not have her own house, so she rents.

Tania works raising chickens, which she then sells plucked.  She also buys chickens to sell.  She has done this job for eight years and has regular customers.  She also sells different brands of cosmetics, a business she has been in for three years.

She is on her fourth loan in the communal bank, and she is going to invest it in buying chickens and cosmetics to continue with her businesses.

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy chickens and cosmetics.

loans.name: Try

texts.en: Mr. Try lives with his older sister in Ang Snoul district. He works for a garment factory, while his sister works in the rice fields. Try typically earns about $100 a month. Every day he goes to work by hiring some form of taxi service. This is a significant monthly expense; therefore, he is seeking funds from HKL, a partner of Kiva, to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for commuting to work. Try tells us that he will work hard to better his position, and he won’t make a late payment back to our lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.name: Aynura

texts.en:
Aynura is a thirty-four-year-old married woman with three sons. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. For the last ten years, Aynura has bred cattle and cows. She was a housewife but her husband`s salary as taxi driver was too low to cover family needs and so Aynura decided to purchase her first cow. 

Aynura usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells them for more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 300 AZN. This business is only one source of income for her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Aynura also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.  

She wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She applied for 1,500 AZN loan to purchase two cattle, one milking cow and fodder. This will be her third loan and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle, one milking cow and fodder.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.en:
Mauricia is fifty-one years old and married with two children.

Mauricia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Mauricia has borrowed and paid for twelve loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for seven years and also earns an income from hog raising.

Mauricia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Keneth

texts.fr:
Keneth est  un homme âgé de 27 ans. Il est célibataire. 
Keneth travaille comme revendeur de pièces détachées depuis 2008. Il vend seul et dans une boutique. Sa difficulté principale est la concurrence sur le marché.
Keneth a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pièces détachées à deux roues.
Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité, l’agrandir et plus tard avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Keneth is a 27-year-old single man. He runs a shop where he has been selling spare parts since 2008, and he works alone. His main hurdle is the competition he faces in the market.

Keneth is seeking his first loan from WAGES to buy bicycle parts.

He plans to reinvest in his activity, expand his business, and someday have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, a 47-year-old mother of six children, is from Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur where she has operated a general store as the family's source of income for 10 years, earning PHP 2,500 a month.

Alice became a member of GDMPC in the year 2009 and is now requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional products to sell. She hopes to expand her store to gain more profits to help sustain her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona, a 45-year-old married mother of one son, is an IDP (internally displaced person) living in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. For the past 12 years Sona has been breeding cattle and cows in order to supplement her husband`s salary, which is too low to cover family needs. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, where people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Sona also keeps milk cows for personal use and to sell to neighbors. She also sells home products.

Sona usually buys small calves, raising and fattening them for five-six months, and then reselling them for profit in the livestock bazaar. The business earns about 250 AZN each month and is now the family's main source of income. Because she wants to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions, Sona is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase three heads of cattle, one milk cow, and one baby calf. She has a good client history, and this will be her fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy three heads of cattle, one milk cow and one baby calf.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a welding shop business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a cafeteria. Josephine is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more materials for her welding shop business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her shop

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya works hard to support her family. Ligaya is married and has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines.

Ligaya requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Ligaya has been in this business for 40 years now and also earns additional income from a general store.

In the future, Ligaya would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is 45 years old, married, and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Nelita runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like shampoo, groceries etc. to sell in her variety store.

Nelita has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for eight years and also earns an income from raising pigs. Nelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, groceries etc. to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
From an area distant from Phnom Penh city, Mrs Phan, age 38, has tried hard to make a livelihood. Phan is a good mother of 3 single children. All of them are helpful to their mother in running their business of selling coffee besides school.  Moreover, Phan has owned a small hairdressing salon in her house in order to generate additional income.

Recently, Phan’s house is under construction and Phan really needs more funds to get her house finished. So now she decided to apply for a loan from HKL in the sum of $500 to pay for the construction. For her future goal, she hopes she will be able to expand her existing business in the coming years.

loans.use: to pay for construction

loans.name: Nelly Beth

texts.en:
Nelly Beth is 28 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

For the past four years Nelly Beth has run a general store in the Philippines. She sells a variety of items such as spices, soap, coffee, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Nelly Beth has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock for her store to sell. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store to sell.

loans.name: Kidéou

texts.fr:
Kidéou est une femme  âgé(e) de 33 ans.  Elle a 02 enfants, tous scolarisés. L’ainé a 07ans et le dernier 04ans.
Kidéou travaille comme revendeuse de bois de chauffe et charbon de bois depuis 2000. Elle vend seule à ses clients à la maison et n’a pas de difficulté principale.
Kidéou a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbons de bois et des bois de chauffe. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Kidéou voudrait  faire prospérer son activité.  Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kidéou is a 33-year-old woman with two children aged 7 and 4, both in school. 

She has been selling charcoal and firewood since 2000. She works alone, from her home, and is not currently facing any major obstacle.

Kidéou is seeking her first loan from WAGES to buy firewood and sacks of charcoal for resale. She plans to reinvest in her activity.

In the coming years, Kidéou would like to see her business thrive. She will use her profits to ensure her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy firewood and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ángela Asunción

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal La Mocora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ángela, tiene 27 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tiene una hija de 3 años. 

Ella es una gran madre que además de estar al tanto de su pequeña hija también se dedica al comercio, vende productos elaborados en cerámica, como centros de mesas, adornos, recuerdos, floreros entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días en su casa que es donde ella vende sus productos. También realiza trabajos de pintado de uñas lo cual lo hace tanto en su casa como a domicilio.  Las cerámicas que  vende las compra en La Pila lugar donde fabrican las mejores artesanías, obras que son muy apreciadas en todo el país. Lleva más de 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar más artesanías de cerámica. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace seis ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos le son de gran ayuda.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darle lo mejor a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
The members of the La Mocora Community Bank meet every other week in the La Mocora area of Colon in the city of Portoviejo, an area known for its hard-working people who work in agriculture and with livestock.

In this place we met Mrs. Ángela. She is 27 years old and separated, but with a 3 year old daughter. She is a great mother who, in addition to caring for her young daughter, also works in sales. She sells ceramic products like centerpieces, decorations, souvenirs, vases, and other items. She works every day selling her products from her home. She also works giving manicures from her home and in other homes. The ceramics she sells are bought from La Pila, a place where the best artisans work making items that are desired by the whole country. She has been doing this work for 6 years and it is going very well for her.

This loan is to buy more ceramic items. She has been in the community bank for 6 cycles and she likes it because the loans are a great help.

Her dreams are to keep moving forward and to give the best to her young daughter.

loans.use: buy ceramic goods

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan, 44, is married and has two children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Rovshan buys young cattle to raise and fatten in five to six months, then sells them at a profit in the local livestock bazaar. He also raises cows for the milk and yogurt that he sells to the neighbors. Rovshan has more than seven years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him the best ways to look after cattle.

Milk, yogurt and meat are very popular foods in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and often use yogurt as a sauce. Milk products are considered very healthy to eat; they are present in everyday life.

Rovshan’s cattle business brings in 200 AZN a month, the family’s only income. It is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. He has applied for a 1300 AZN loan with ACU (his second loan with them) to purchase two cattle, one milker and fodder for them. Rovshan has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle, one milker and fodder for them.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.en: This time Gumercinda is applying for a loan of Php 45,000 to fund her shell-crafting business. The shell craft enterprise that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide her and her family with income that is improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials for a shell-crafting business.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
El señor  Cesar,  tiene 29 años, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene 2 hijos de 1 y 7  años, reside en el Barrio La estación en el Municipio de Tela, Atlántida. 
Don Cesar se dedica a la venta de lácteos, carnes y embutidos, anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa en la distribución de embutidos, lo cual le sirvió para conocer que existía demanda de lácteos y carnes en la ruta que atendía.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 20,000 Lempiras para la inversión en compra de queso crema, queso frijolero, queso seco, mantequilla, embutidos, carne de res y cerdo.
Cesar espera seguir creciendo en su negocio y con las utilidades dar la educación a sus hijos, poder construir su casa y adquirir equipo (motocicleta) para hacer la distribución del producto más rápido.
texts.en:
Cesar, age 29, is in a common-law marriage and has two children, ages one and seven.  He lives in the La Estación neighborhood  in the Tela municipality, Atlántida.

Cesar sells dairy products, meat, and sausages.  He previously worked for a company distributing sausages.  This helped him learn that there was a demand for dairy products and meat on his route.

He is currently requesting a loan for 20,000 lempiras to buy cream cheese, Frijolero cheese, dried cheese, butter, sausages, beef, and pork.

Cesar hopes to continue growing in his business.  He will use the profits to give his children an education, build his house, and get a motorcycle in order to more rapidly distribute the products.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, meat, and sausages.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 35 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Cherry works very hard to provide for them.

Cherry runs a sari-sari store, a type of convenience store, in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy groceries to sell in her store.

Cherry has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as shampoo and canned goods.

In the future, Cherry would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 43 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.

Helen is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Helen has been raising pigs for eight years now and has borrowed from NWTF seven times to sustain her business.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 54 years old and married with five children. For the past ten years she has earned a living through her pig fattening business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from selling fish and water.

Rhoda is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 37 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Gina has a sari-sari store, a type of convenience store, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. Gina requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Casria

texts.en:
Casria is from Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 46 years old, married, and has two children. Casria makes her living running a general store, selling a variety of food and home products in the local community. She has been in this business for ten years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for her work. 

Casria is requesting a loan of 7,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. In 2008, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her store.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 33 years old, and he repairs computers and televisions to earn a living. He has been in this business for three years. 

Since James joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 30,000 KES to buy computer and television spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair computers and televisions.

loans.name: Felma

texts.en:
Felma is from Camanga in Tukuran municipality, Zamboanga del Sur province on the island of Mindanao. She is 28 years old and is married with one child.

Felma sells fruit like watermelon and pomelos (a citrus fruit) to the local community. She has done so for the past five years and earns 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Felma joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is now requesting a new loan of 4,900 PHP which will be used to buy more fruit to sell. She plans to use her additional profits to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr:
Akouavi est une femme  âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée å un  chauffeur. Elle a 02 enfants, dont 01 à l’école. Le premier a 28 ans et le dernier a 22 ans.  
Akouavi travaille comme revendeuse de piments secs, poissons salés et fumés depuis 2007. Elle sert ses clients dans un marché. 
Akouavi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des piments et autres. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité avec les profits réalisés.
Dans les prochaines années, Akouavi voudrait faire prospérer son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Akouavi is 47 years old and married to a driver. They have two children aged 22 and 28. One of them attends school.  

Akouavi has been selling dried peppers as well as smoked and salted fish since 2007. She conducts her business at the market. 

Akouavi is seeking her first loan from WAGES to buy peppers and other items. She wants to reinvest the profits in her activity.

In the coming years, Akouavi would like to see her business thrive. Her profits will help her to ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy dried peppers, smoked fish and salted fish for resale.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 22 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She is from Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur in the Philippines. Lea operates a service-based business, providing transportation to local community members to earn a living. She's been doing this for one year, and every month she earns 1,000 PHP from this work. 

She has requested a loan of 2,500 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. In 2008, Lea joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Lea hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in her business.

loans.name: Yegana

texts.en:
Yegana is a 45-year-old woman who is married with two sons. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives with her family in an IDP Settlement. She is a farmer, raising seasonal fruits and vegetables. Her 20 years of experience in this field make her a very skilled farmer. Raising crops takes a lot of strength and working in the open air, for which Yegana requires a lot of help from her son. 

Yegana usually sells her crop in the central bazaar. Locally, people eat fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. In fact, many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Azerbaijani families serve fresh fruits at every meal, and fruits are also often used to make fresh punch. 

Yegana's monthly income is 200 AZN, and she needs additional capital to invest in seed and fertilizer. This will allow her to improve the quality of her produce and increase her monthly turnover. For this purpose she applied for 1000 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married and the father of two children. He is an electrician and has been in the business for six years. Because there is limited competition in the area, he describes his business as a good one.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, John has been able to save money. He has now applied for a 15,000 KES loan to buy electrical wires and sockets. John is working to become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy electrical wires and sockets.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married with three children aged one, seven and ten years. She has been selling cereals for two years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

Jane has applied for a first loan with KADET LTD of 52,000 KES. She plans to use the loan to buy more maize to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to provide basic needs for her family.

Jane hopes to grow her business and open a big wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is 30 years old and in the business of shoe making and selling. He supports three people in his family. He has been in this business for fours years and earns a monthly income of KES. 4,000.

He has requested for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy more leather and other materials for making shoes. The profit from his business would help him repay his loan. 

Ben’s dream is to improve his living standard through hard work.

loans.use: To buy more leather and other materials for making shoes.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is a married woman with 3 children aged 16, 8 and 3. Her husband works as a farmer.

Celestina sells food items to her community in Trinidad, Bohol. She makes rice cakes, pancakes, and banana cue. Celestina has had her business for 4 years and she earns about 3000 php per month. She has requested a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, margarine and milk. 

Celestina hopes to earn better and be able to provide for all her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, margarine and milk

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 45 years old and married with three children. She does poultry farming to earn a living and has been in the business for 4 years. She also runs a retail shop to earn extra income. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to grow her business, and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Jesselyn

texts.en:
Jesselyn is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines; she has been in this business for 13 years now, and she works hard to support her family. 

Jesselyn requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more linen for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more linen for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Brigid

texts.en:
Brigid is a single lady aged 29 years old and blessed with three children aged 12,10 and 8 years old. She owns an agro-vet retail shop in Kapsabet town and has been in operation for a period of three years, earning a monthly income of KES.12,000.

She is servicing a first term loan of KES. 20,000 with KADET LTD and wishes to use the amount to purchase herbicides, minerals and seeds. The profits will be used to start a retail shop within the town.  

She hopes to start a wholesale agro-chemical shop and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy herbicides, minerals and seeds

loans.name: Keki Group

texts.en:
Stella, who is in her mid 20's, is single with one small child. She has been a food vendor for seven months now. She works from 5.00 am to 4.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use for buying more stock of food and will start selling soft drinks. Her dream is to one day be able to own a Hotel.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Keki" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food and and soft drinks to sell to more people.

loans.name: Lkhagvasuren

texts.en:
Mr. Lkhagvasuren, 47, earns a living using his minivan to transport passengers around Kherlen, a boundary town of Mongolia. He has been in this business since 2009 and already has permanent clients. He lives with his wife in a ger, a traditional, nomadic Mongolian yurt. He wants to slowly improve his business and, eventually, to have his own passenger transportation agency. 

Recently, Mr. Lkhagvasuren purchased a new minivan because his previous one was very old and heavily damaged, making it difficult to use for his business. Now he needs a loan to purchase some spare parts for his new minivan.

loans.use: to purchase the some spare parts for his new minivan.

loans.name: Dilshad

texts.ru: Dilshad 42 goda, ona zamujem i u nee 2 detey. Ona zanimaetsa torgovley 8 let, ee biznes sostoit iz prodaji jenskoy odejdi i parfumerii. Ona xochen otkrit svoy sobstvenniy magazin, ee mechta eto postroit dom dla sina i radi etogo ona staraetsa stoyat krepko v svoem biznese, rasshirit ee i delaet vse vozmojnoe chtobi dobitsa svoey celi. Dilshad xochet dengi v kredit v sumee 1000 azn chtobi kupit noviy tovar na prodaju. Ona zarane blagodarna i nadeetsa na pomosh.
texts.en: Dilshad is 42 years old, married and has two children.  She has been involved in sales for eight years, and her business is selling women's clothing and perfumes.  She wants to open her own store and dreams of building a house for her son.  For this, she tries to maintain a strong business, expand it and do everything possible to achieve her goal.  Dilshad wants to borrow money in the sum of 1000 AZN in order to purchase new merchandise for sale.  She is grateful in advance and relies on the help.

loans.use: to buy new clothing for resale

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal La Mocora.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 51 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas mayores de edad, la menor de ella estudia en Universidad y es la que aun vive con ella, la mayor ya está comprometida. El marido es chofer.
 
Ella es una gran ama de casa que tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. en la cual trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hija y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo, los productos los compra en Portoviejo aunque la mayoría de sus productos los recibe en su local. Lleva más de 15 años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta por la ayuda que dan para seguir adelante. 

Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio y que este  crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of 'La Mocora' community bank meet in Colon parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its hard-working people who farm and raise livestock.

This is also where 51-year-old María lives.  María lives with her common-law husband and has two adult daughters.  Her youngest is studying at University and still lives with her.  Her eldest is already engaged.  María's husband is a driver.

María is a great homemaker who has a grocery store in her home.  There she sells all kinds of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, etc.  She works every day, from 7.00am to 10.00pm, and sometimes until even later.  Her daughter and husband help her in her work.  She buys some of her products in Portoviejo but most of them are delivered to her premises.  She has been in this business for more than 15 years and it is doing very well.

María will use this loan to further stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other basic household products.  She has been a member of her community bank since it was founded and she likes it because of the help that she is given which helps her to make progress.  Her goal is to continue making progress in her business and to expand it further every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other basic household products

loans.name: Samangul

texts.ru: Samangul upravlaet svoey fermoy vot uje 30 let. Ey 57 let, ona jivet s mujem i s 4 detmi. Ee semya pomogaet ey vesti svoy biznes. U nee 3 korovi i 2 bika. Ona prodaet molochnie produkti i telyatinu na bazare. Samangul xochet dengi chtobi kupit stroy materiali na remont doma i poetomu prosit kredit v 500 azn. Ona ne xo4et prodat korovu dla remonta tak kak ot etogo postradayut ee doxodi s biznesa. Samangul ochen privetlivaya i trudolibivaya jenshina kotoraya staraetsa uluchshit jizn svoix detey.
texts.en: Samangul has been running her farm for 30 years.  She is 57 years old, lives with her husband and four children.  Her family helps her to run this business.  Samangul has three cows and two bulls.  She sells dairy products and veal at a market.  She wants to borrow money to purchase building materials to repair her house, and this is why she is requesting a loan in the sum of 500 AZN.  Samangul does not want to sell cows in order to make repairs because her business profits would suffer.  Samangul is a very friendly and hardworking woman, who tries hard to improve her children's lives.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair the house

loans.name: Leila Indalacia

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal La Mocora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Leila,  tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad, solo su hija menor aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer profesional.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y zapatillas,  pero siempre busca lo que este de temporada para que tengan más salida, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta pero también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando lleva mercadería nueva. Trabaja tres días a la semana fuera de su casa y en ella todos los días, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra todas las semanas. Su mercadería  la compra en Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 11 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien. 

Este crédito es para comprar bermudas, trajes de baño, camisetas, blusas, zapatillas, sandalias, entre otras cosas. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque todas sus amigas son muy cumplidas.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante con su negocio y  en su vida personal.
texts.en:
In La Mocora locality of Colon parish, city of Portoviejo -- a place known for its hard-working people dedicated to agriculture and cattle raising -- members of the Banco Comunal La Mocora meet every 15 days.
    
In this place we know Leila, who is 51 years old and married. From this relationship has come 3 children now grown, plus a minor daughter who still lives with Leila. Her husband is a driver by profession.

Leila sells clothing of all types plus tennis shoes, and always searches for what is in season in order to gain more sales. She sells door to door but also sells from her home where customers come when she has new merchandise. Leila works 3 days a week outside her home and at home every day. She offers credit to her customers and collects payments weekly. Leila buys her merchandise in Guayaquil when she requires more. She has been in this business for 11 years and it has gone well.

This loan is to buy Bermuda shorts, bathing suits, T-shirts, blouses, tennis shoes, and sandals among other items. Leila is a founding member of her communal bank and she likes it because all her friends are very responsible.

Her dreams are to continue to advance in her business and her personal life.

loans.use: buy Bermuda shorts, bathing suits, sport shirts, blouses, tennis shoes and sandals, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Charie

texts.en:
Charie is a twenty-three-year-old married woman with a one-year-old child. She and her husband run a fishing business in their town. Fishing has been her family's source of income for three years. Charie helps her husband by selling his catch at the market. Charie works hard to improve their income and take care of her family.

Charie has requested this loan to buy more fishing nets. She hopes to earn better and be able to save for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy more fishing nets.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is twenty-three years old. An enterprising business man, he is single but helps his parents. He has been running a barber shop for the past three years with a  monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to cater for his basic needs.

He is applying for his first loan term from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  Jacob will use the loan to buy shaving machines for his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his siblings. His hopes and dreams are to open a salon for his sister.

loans.use: To buy shaving machines for his business

loans.name: Cleofas

texts.en:
Cleofas is married with four children. Cleofas is fifty-three years old and lives in Poblacion, Godod, Zamboanga del Norte.

Cleofas sells rubber to earn a living. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more rubber to sell.

Cleofas has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Cleofas hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber to sell.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is a forty-six-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has four children aged between sixteen and twenty-two. 

Edwina is engaged in fishing. Her husband, who is a fisherman, operates their fishing boat to catch fish. Edwina sells her husband's catch at their town's market. Edwina's family has been relying on fishing for 20 years.

Edwina has requested this loan to purchase a fishing boat. This will help expand their fishing business. Edwina hopes for her family to experience a progressive life.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat.

loans.name: Gedion

texts.en:
Gedion is fifty-two years old, married, with two children. He does maize farming to earn a living. He has been in the business for seven years and employs one person. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his income in the future. He has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru: Нурали кредитор в организации четвёртый год.Он отец четверых детей, которые ему помогают по бизнесу.Его бизнес откорм и продажа скота. В основном его скот пасётся на пригорных пастбищах, поэтому в день мониторинга его скот был на пастбище. Его район проживания отдалён от города, два часа езды. Местные мужчины занимаются животноводством, так вот и Нурали полностью занят расширением своего дела. Нурали инвалид второй группы, но дееспособный, у него с детства паралич левой руки,но он вполне справляется сам. Его старший сын пригоняет вечером скот дамой и они вместе с отцом дают им вечерний корм .
texts.en: Nurali is a lender in the organization for the fourth year. He is a father of four children who help him in the business. His business is fattening and selling of livestock. Most of his livestock is grazing on pastures near the mountains so on the day of monitoring his cattle was at the pasture. His area of ​​residence is distant from the town which is a two hour drive away. Local men are engaged in animal husbandry and so is Nurali who is fully occupied by expansion of the business. Nurali has a second degree handicap, he has a paralysis of the left hand since his childhood, but he is a capable man and can manage on his own. His eldest son fetches the cattle home in the evening and then together with the father give the cattle their evening fodder.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and fodder for livestock.

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
El señor José,  tiene 38 años, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 14  años, reside en La comunidad del Cedral en el Municipio de Las Vegas, Santa Bárbara. 
Don José se dedica desde su niñez a la agricultura, él posee una manzana de tierra cultivada con café, el cual comercializa en pergamino húmedo. 
Al realizar la comercialización  obtiene buenas ganancias ya que es  café de excelente calidad porque lo produce a una altura de más de 1600 msnm (metros sobre el nivel del mar).
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 16,000 Lempiras para la compra de fertilizantes para abonar el café y obtener una mayor producción.
Él espera en un futuro ampliar sus cultivos y su producción.
texts.en:
José is 38 years old and is in a civil union with his wife. He has two children who are 12 and 14 years old. He lives the community of Cedral in the Las Vegas municipality of Santa Barbara.

José Has made his living in agriculture since childhood. He has 1 manzana of land (about 1.7 acres) planted with coffee. He sells the coffee as wet pergamino. Once he sells it he makes a good profit as the coffee is of excellent quality because he grows it at an altitude higher than 1600 m.a.s.l. (meters above sea level).

Currently he is requesting a loan in the amount of 16,000 Lempiras to buy fertilizers to fertilize the coffee and have better production. 

In the future he hopes to increase his crops and production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to fertilize coffee crops.

loans.name: Yadira Judith

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal La Mocora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Yadira, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos niñas de 10 y 5 años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es agricultor y chofer.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta. También los fines de semana prepara encebollados en las mañanas y meriendas en las tardes y noches, con lo cual se gana algo de dinero extra, ella también vende su mercadería en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días, deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Manta cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesita. Tiene más de 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar bermudas, trajes de baño, camisetas y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener algún día un gran local.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of "La Mocora" community bank meet in Colon parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its hard-working residents who farm and raise livestock.

Here we meet 37-year-old Yadira who is married and has two daughters aged 10 and 5.  They are both in elementary school.  Her husband is a farmer and driver.

Yadira's business is selling all kinds of clothing.  She makes her sales door to door.  On the weekend, she makes 'encebollados' (fish stew) in the mornings and snacks in the afternoons and evenings.  This makes her some extra money.  She also sells merchandise from her home where she has a small sales location.  

Yadira works every day.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment every weekend.  She buys her merchandise in Manta every two weeks or every month, depending on what she needs.  She has been in this business for more than eight years and it is doing very well.

Yadira is taking out this loan to buy Bermuda shorts, swimsuits, t-shirts and supplies with which to prepare her food.  She is a founding member of her community bank and she likes it because of the help that she receives through the loans.  

Yadira's dreams are to get ahead in life and, some day, to have large sales premises.

loans.use: to buy Bermuda shorts, swimsuits, t-shirts and food supplies

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is seventy-five years old, disabled, and married to Wayua. They are blessed with five children.

David offers Tuktuk transport services in the area of Kakuyuni - Tala . He has been in this business for the last three years and gets an income of KES 12,000 per month.

He is applying for his first loan of KES 5,000 from KADET Ltd. which he will use to buy spare parts for his Tuktuk. He will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for his children and save for the future. David hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is thirty-one years old. A business lady, she is married to Leonard, a business man. They are blessed with one child aged four. She has been running a boutique for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 18,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her third loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Margaret will use the loan to buy new clothes for her shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to open boutiques in different areas which will help her improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is twenty-nine years old. He is married with three children. 

He sells bags, shoes and sweaters to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years and describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. He earns extra income from maize farming. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 15,000 Kenya Shillings to buy bags, shoes and sweaters to sell.

loans.use: To buy bags, shoes and sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra forma parte del Banco comunal “Cuento Contigo”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica a preparar almuerzos desde hace un año y medio. Trabaja en su propia casa, ahí preparara y sirve sus platos, los días lunes a sábado.
Les vende almuerzo a un grupo de mecánicos. Comenta que comenzó preparando empanadas de marisco, posteriormente empezaron a solicitar sus preparaciones en cantidades y a domicilio por encargo.
Su mercadería la compra una vez al mes en la vega central “mercado en el cual se comercializan frutas, verduras y abarrotes a bajo costo”. Y la carne la compra en una carnicería.
Con el crédito comprará una cocina, loza y mercadería para la preparación de sus alimentos. 
Comenta que una de las metas para su negocio, es instalarse con un minimarket, en el cual pueda trabajar toda su familia.
Sandra vive junto a su marido y también junto a su padre.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Además comenta que el grupo del cual forma parte es muy responsable, lo cual la mantiene muy motivada. 
Respecto a las capacitaciones, están le han servido para distribuir de mejor manera sus utilidades. 
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the “Cuento Contigo” (I'm Relying on You) community bank, which is based in the city of Talca.  Her business is preparing meals and she has been in this business for a year and a half.  She works from home, which is where she prepares and serves her dishes.  She works from Monday to Saturday.

Sandra sells lunches to a group of mechanics.  She says that she started out preparing seafood empanadas.  Her customers then started requesting her food in bulk and ordered it for home delivery.

Sandra buys her merchandise once a month in "La Vega Central" (a market in which they sell low-cost fruit, vegetables and groceries).  She buys her meat from a butcher's.

Sandra will use her loan to buy a stove, crockery and merchandise for preparing her food.  She says that one of her business goals is to set up a mini-mart where her entire family can work.  Sandra lives together with her husband and her father.

Sandra is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that she has been given by Fondo Esperanza as it will allow her to invest in her business.  She says that her community bank is made up of responsible people which keeps her very motivated.

As regards the training sessions, Sandra says that they have helped her to better distribute her profits.

Talca is located in Maule region, in the central area of Chile.  It is the region's administrative, economic and cultural center, and the most important city in the Chilean Central Valley region.  There is an interesting expression in Chile about Talca: the phrase "Talca, Paris and London".  There are different legends as to its origins.  Some say that it comes from something an Englishman once said: "Talca parece Londres" (Talca is a bit like London), owing to the fog which frequently covers the city during the Winter, just like it does in the UK capital.

loans.use: to buy a stove, crockery and merchandise for preparing her food

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa, solicita un nuevo préstamo, ya que quiere abastecer el negocio de nuevas prendas de vestir como camisas, camisetas, pantalones, ropa interior para ambos sexos, este préstamo será un gran aporte para Rosa y para mantener a su clientela satisfecha.
Ella ha tenido un efecto positivo en el negocio después de utilizar el primer préstamo, por eso nuevamente se acerca para continuar creciendo como comerciante.
texts.en:
Rosa is requesting another loan as she wants to supply her business with new clothing like shirts, t-shirts, pants, and underwear for both sexes. This loan will be a big help for Rosa and will keep her customers satisfied.  

She has had good results with the business after using the first loan. This why she has come again to continue growing as a salesperson.

loans.use: to buy shirts, t-shirts, pants and underwear.

loans.name: Olivian

texts.en:
Olivian is married with three children all of whom are under fifteen. They live in Ntamulung Quarter in Bamenda Mezam Division of North West region of Cameroon. 

Olivian has faced challenges in life such as abuse from her husband because she was not doing anything to produce income for the family before she joined GHAPE. This was also because she was unable to raise capital to start a business. She also dropped out of school because her parents were unable to pay her schools fees in addition to not being able to provide for other school needs. For these reasons, she became frustrated, and felt like her only option was marriage. However, her matrimonial home has also not been easy. 

She will add her personal contribution to this loan to buy a new motor bike which will help to ease transportation in the neighborhood. The profit from her previous loan was used to educate her children. She thinks her business will succeed because of longevity and experience in the business. Her community will have transport available at all times and the fees will also be very moderate so everyone in the community can benefit.  

The profit from the loan will be used to pay her children's school fees, and also support her husband financially in times of difficulty.

She says a GHAPE loan is preferable because of the low interest rate, and also convenient installment repayments.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is thirty-three years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has five children with three of them currently in school. For the past two years, Peter has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like sugar to resell. This will help Peter to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Peter hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Peter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peter who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like sugar, to resell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is twenty-three years old and supports three member of her family. She is married to James and they are blessed with two children aged six and two. 

She has been a tailor for three years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. She has requested a loan worth KES 40,000 to buy materials, threads and needles for her business. 

The profit she will make will help her expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials, threads and needles for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Brisas Del Mar -  Portoviejo Group

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como Los Arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las 15 socias y los 3 socios del Banco Comunal Brisas Del Mar, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido de mucho, ya que con los créditos han mejorado sus negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Teresa, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene ocho hijos todos mayores de edad, el menor de ellos viven con ella, además de un niño de 11 años el mismo que estudia en colegio y que lo crio desde pequeño ya que su madre falleció.  El marido trabaja ocasionalmente. y también le ayuda en su negocio.
 
Ella tiene una tienda general en su casa, allí vende de todo un poco desde arroz, azúcar, detergentes enlatados, carne, pescado, camarón, legumbres y también vende ciertos remedios y artículos de bazar como ropa, zapatos y bisutería, trabaja todos los días desde las 06h00 hasta las 20h00 con la ayuda de su esposo y de sus hijos. La mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Portoviejo y otros de los productos los recibe en su local. Lleva 2 años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para surtir su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, atún, detergentes, artículos de bazar y otros productos de primera necesidad. Ella es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución.

Sus sueños son tener un carro y un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
In the parish of Crucita in Portoviejo Canton we find a place known as Los Arenales, where the 15 women and 3 men who are members of Brisas Del Mar Communal Bank meet every two weeks.  This place is known for its pretty beaches, its gastronomy, and the warmth of its people.

This is a group of people who decided to get together and form this communal bank that has served them well, because with the loans they have improved their businesses.  They work in different jobs, such as sales, service, and food sales, among other activities. 

One of the members of this group is Teresa, 56.  She is married and from this relationship has eight children, all of age.  The youngest of them lives with her, as does an 11-year-old child who studies in high school and whom she raised from a little boy because his mother died.  Her husband works occasionally and also helps her in her business.

She has a general store in her house.  There she sells a little bit of everything, from rice, sugar, detergent, canned goods, meat, fish, shrimp, vegetables, and also certain remedies and hardware items such as clothing, shoes, and costume jewelry.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. with the help of her husband and her children.  She buys her merchandise in the city of Portoviejo, and she receives other products in her store.  She has had her business for two years and it is going very well for her.

This loan is to stock her store.  She is going to buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergent, hardware items, and other household necessities.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because of the benefits she gets from the institution.

Her dreams are to have a car and a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergent, housewares, and other household necessities.

loans.name: Visente

texts.es:
El señor  Vicente tiene 55 años, está casado, tiene 3  hijas de las edades de 23, 22,  y 16 años. Reside en El Barrio Lempira ubicado en el Municipio de Morazán, Yoro.
Don Vicente tiene por actividad económica la producción, compra y venta de granos básicos, él  se dedica a esta actividad porque es bien rentable y le genera buenas ganancias.
Dos de sus hijas trabajan en fabricas maquiladoras aportando a la economía del hogar.
Actualmente ha solicitado su octavo préstamo por la suma de 12,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de granos básicos para la venta y la producción de Maíz.
Don Vicente espera continuar invirtiendo bien su préstamo, tiene por meta la compra de más terreno para ampliar la producción de cultivos y aumentar sus ganancias para ofrecer una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
