Sr. Vicente is 55 years old, married, and has three daughters (ages 23, 22, and 16). He lives in the neighborhood of Lempira in the town of Morazán, Yoro.

Don Vicente has a production business that involves buying and selling basic grains. He decided to pursue this business because it is profitable and generates good earnings. Two of his daughters work at factories in order to help with the household expenses.

Vicente is currently requesting his eighth loan in the amount of 12,000 HNL to invest in basic grains to sell and the production of corn. He hopes to continue investing well with his loan. His goal is to buy more land so that he can expand his production of crops and to increase his earnings, which will enable him to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase grains to sell and to produce corn.

loans.name: Oscar Rolando

texts.es: Oscar, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio, ya que quiere seguir mejorando, comprara pollos pequeños y concentrado, para aumentar la granja, él considera que estos préstamos le permiten mantenerse en actividad, ya que su granja no ha dejado de ser productiva, dándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Oscar is requesting a new loan to invest in his business because he would like to continue improving it.  He will buy chicks and concentrated feed in order to expand his farm.  He believes that these loans allow him to remain in business as his farm continues to remain productive, providing more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy chicks and concentrated feed

loans.name: Ajdar

texts.ru: Ajdaru 48 let. On jenat i u nego dvoe vzroslix detey. Vot uje 16 let kak on upravlaet selskoxozaystvennim biznesom, emu pomogayut v etom dele ego semya.  U nego 32 melko rogatogo skota. Ajdar prodayet maslo, sir, moloko i maso. Ego pokupateli eto mestnie jiteli poselka.  V budushem on planiruet rasshirit svoyu fermu. Ajdar prostoy i trudolubiviy chelovek. Segodna emu nujni dengi dla remonta doma, iza otsustviya remonta v dome zimoy bivaet xolodno. On nadeetsa na vashu pomosh i zarane blagodaren.
texts.en: Ajdar is 48 years old, married and has two adult children.  He has been running an agricultural business for 16 years, and his family helps him with this business.  He has 32 heads of small livestock.  Ajdar sells butter, cheese, milk and meat.  His customers are the local village residents.  He plans to expand his farm in the future.  Ajdar is a simple and hardworking person.  Today, he needs money to repair his house because without the repairs, it gets cold in the house in the winter.  He relies on your help and is grateful in advance.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair his house

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, se ha decidido por obtener un nuevo préstamo, ya que con la ayuda de estos ha logrado mantenerse en el negocio, la inversión de este préstamo será en la compra de cerdos para destazo y comercializar la carne.
El efecto que estos préstamos tienen en el negocio de Carmen es bueno, ya que le permiten comprar  los cerdos para seguir realizando el destazo y sobre todo continuar en las ventas.
texts.en:
Carmen has decided to take another loan. With the help of these loans he has been able to stay in business. He will invest this loan in the purchase of pigs for butchering to sell the meat. 

The loans have had a good effect on Carmen's business because they allow him to buy the pigs to continue to butcher and above all continue with his sales.

loans.use: to buy pigs to butcher.

loans.name: Willian Alexander

texts.es:
Willian, necesita invertir en la venta de minutas, por eso solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales como vasos descartables, cucharas, jaleas, hielo, pan, todo esto para preparar las minutas de calidad, con buen sabor para los clientes.
Él tuvo un efecto positivo del préstamo anterior, mejorando en el negocio y manteniendo la disponibilidad de productos para las ventas.
texts.en:
Willian needs to invest in his business selling 'minutas' (shaved ice with fruit syrup).  He is requesting a loan to buy materials such as disposable cups, spoons, jelly, ice and bread, so that he can prepare good-tasting, top-quality 'minutas' for his customers.

Willian's previous loan had a positive effect.  He improved his business and had available the products he needed to make his sales.

loans.use: to buy disposable cups, spoons, jelly, ice and bread

loans.name: Zaida Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal La Mocora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Zaida, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 7 y 2 años de  edad, el mayor estudia escuela. Su esposo es mecánico automotriz.
 
Ella es Ing. En Contabilidad y Auditoría y realiza trabajos contables en forma independiente, para lo cual adecuo en su casa una pequeña oficina en la cual realiza sus trabajos y recibe a los clientes que todos los días requieren de sus servicios, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, allí realiza todo tipo de trabajos contables como pagaos de impuestos auditorias, etc. Ella lleva 5 años desempeñando estas funciones y tiene muchos clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar un archivador que le hace mucha falta y suministros de oficina que le permitan realizar mejor su trabajo. Lleva 5 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido adecuar su oficina.
 
Su sueño es tener una oficina en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
In the area known as La Mocora in the parish of Colon of the city of Portoviejo, the members of the Communal Bank “La Mocora” meet every 15 days. This place is known for its hardworking people, who engage in agriculture and livestock breeding.

It is here that one can meet Sra. Zaida. She is 34 years old, married, and has two children (ages 7 and 2). The older child is in school. Her husband is an auto mechanic.

Zaida is an accountant and auditor who works independently on accounting assignments. For this reason, she has a small office in her house where she performs her work and welcomes her customers who visit her every day whenever they need her services. Zaida works Monday through Friday from 8am to 5pm. She performs all types of accounting jobs such as tax payments, audits, and other services. Zaida has provided these services for five years and has many customers.

This loan will be used to buy a filing cabinet that she lacks and office supplies so that she can perform her job better. She has participated in her Communal Bank for five loan cycles and enjoys being a member because the loans have helped to equip her office. Her dream is to have an office in the central part of the city.

loans.use: to purchase a filing cabinet and office supplies.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio, sodas, jugos, frutas como mangos, sandia, pepinos, para mantenerse en el negocio, esto le ha ayudado a José ya que el  dinero del préstamo lo invierte en compra de productos para no decaer. El considera que su situación ha mejorado, permitiéndole mejorar las ventas.
texts.en: José is requesting a new loan to buy merchandise for his business.  He will buy soda, juice, mangoes, watermelon and cucumbers, so that he can keep his business running.  José's previous loan was invested in buying products to maintain his business.  He believes that his situation has improved and that he improved his sales.

loans.use: to buy soda, juice, mangos, watermelon and cucumbers

loans.name: Tojikhon

texts.ru: Точихон замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Муж работает диспетчером. Более 15 лет она занимается купле- продажей хлебобулочных изделий. Точихон очень трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Точихон торгует на рынке. Она запрашивает займ для покупки хлебобулочных изделий. Она надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Tojikhon is married and is a loving mother of two children.  Her husband works as a dispatcher.  Tojikhon has been involved in buying and selling bakery goods for over 15 years.  She is a very hardworking and conscientious woman.  She sells at a market.  Tojikhon is requesting this loan to purchase bakery goods.  She relies on your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy bread for resale

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.ru: Муътабар замужем и любящая мать четверых детей. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина. Она всегда старается улучшить свои жилищные условия и создать комфорт в своей семье. Более 12 лет она занимается купле- продажей детской одежды. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и с этой целью она запрашивает займ для покупки детской одежды и обуви. Муътабар надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Mutabar is married and is a loving mother of four children.  She is a very hardworking woman.  She always tries to improve her living conditions and create comfort for her family.  Mutabar has been involved in buying and selling children's clothing for over 12 years.  She wants to expand her business and is requesting this loan to achieve this goal by purchasing children's clothing and shoes.  Mutabar relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Paraíso, es madre de 2 hijos, es casada, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace mas de 4 años, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y venta de ropa, esta agradecida con la institución porque pudo sacar adelante su negocio y su familia, desde que está en Finca pudo incrementar su negocio y sacar profesionales a sus hijos, antes solo tenía un negocio ahora ya tiene dos, aprendió a manejar su dinero, como incrementar su negocio, los valores que le enseñan en las charlas y reuniones.
el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en incrementar su mercadería comprando de arroz, azúcar, leche, y tambien la compra de ropa.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Paraíso communal bank. She is the mother of two children, married, and has been a member of Finca Perú for more than four years. She makes a living selling groceries and in clothing sales. 

She is thankful to the institution because she has been able to get her business and her family ahead. Since she has been with Finca she has been able to grow her business and allow her children to become professionals. Before, she had just one business and now she has two. She learned how to manage her money and grow her business, which are the values taught in the talks and meetings. 

She will invest the loan she is requesting now in increasing her merchandise by purchasing rice, sugar, milk, and clothes as well.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk.

loans.name: Jonatan Enrique

texts.es:
Jonatán, necesita un nuevo préstamo, para invertirlo en medicina natural para el negocio, comprando vitaminas, productos medicinales, analgésicos, en diferentes presentaciones para que los clientes elijan su preferencia como pastillas, jarabes, polvos, inyecciones, así está ofreciendo más variedad y mejorara el servicio. 
Él considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho a mantenerse, realizo una buena inversión y hoy en día cuenta con más clientela.
texts.en:
Jonatán needs a new loan in order to invest in natural medicine for the business, buying vitamins, medicines, and analgesics of different kinds so that the customers can choose their preferences such as pills, syrups, powders, injections, thereby offering more variety and improved service.

He thinks that the previous loan helped him to support himself, making a good investment and today he has more customers.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, medicines, and analgesics

loans.name: María Jesús

texts.es: María Jesús es socia del Banco Comunal Paraíso, estando en Finca Perú logró amoblar mas su negocio que es un recreo, se pudo comprar un televisor e invirtió también sus ahorros en la educación de sus hijos, le gusta venir a las reuniones porque le gusta las capacitaciones que les dan, dice que le ayudó a mejorar en su hogar y negocio. El préstamo que solicita ahora lo va a invertir en otro negocio que quiere poner, que es la venta de ropa.
texts.en: María Jesús is a member of the 'Paraíso' (Paradise) community bank.  Being a member of Finca Peru, she was able to further furnish her business (a recreation center).  She was able to buy a television set and invested her savings in her children's education.  She likes attending meetings because she enjoys the training sessions.  She says that they have helped her to improve both her home and her business.  María Jesús will invest the loan that she is requesting in another business that she would like to establish, a clothes sales business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing

loans.name: Elmer Antonio

texts.es:
Elmer, se ha decido a invertir en la agricultura, por eso está solicitando un nuevo préstamo que será utilizado en alquiler de una manzana de terreno, donde se dispone a sembrar el maíz, este préstamo le ayudara a asegurar ya el sitio donde estará trabajando los próximos meses.
Su condición de agricultor ha mejorado, ya que su milpa fue provechosa dándole los frutos deseados, ha mejorado considerablemente en la producción.
texts.en:
Elmer has decided to invest in agriculture, and that is why he is asking for a new loan that will be used to rent a plot of land which he is getting ready to plant corn. This loan will help him to affirm the place where he will be working in the coming months.

His farming activities have improved and his cornfield was profitable giving him the desired results. He production has improved considerably.

loans.use: to pay rent for land

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, el cual utilizara en el pago del alquiler de terreno para cultivar maíz, este préstamo cubrirá con este gasto tan importante para Marleny, ya que es así como apoya a su esposo y familia.
Ella considera que estos préstamos le han dado una mayor seguridad en la producción agrícola, trabajó bien con el pago de las cuotas y espera continuar de la misma manera.
texts.en:
Marleny has decided on a new loan which is to be used in the payment for rent of land in order to grow corn. This loan will cover this expense so important to Marleny as this is how she is able to support her family.

She believes that these loans have given her better security in agricultural production, and she worked well with the payment of her fees and she hopes to continue in the same way.

loans.use: to pay the rent for land in order to plant corn

loans.name: Jose Oswaldo

texts.es:
José, está iniciando nuevamente su labor agrícola, preparándose para cultivar un buen terreno, por esto solicita un préstamo para pagar el alquiler de dos manzanas de terreno, en la cual piensa sembrar el maíz.
José considera que el préstamo anterior le fue muy útil, mejorando las cosechas por el aplicamiento de todos los insumos.
texts.en:
Once again José is beginning his agricultural labor, getting ready to cultivate a good plot of land.  This is why he is requesting a loan to pay the rent on two "manzanas" [approximately 3.5 acres] of land on which he plans to grow corn.

José considers that the previous loan was very useful to him, improving his harvests because of the application of all the agricultural inputs.

loans.use: to pay the rent on two "manzanas" [3.5 acres] of land to plant.

loans.name: Graciela Genoveva

texts.es:
Graciela, quiere volver a surtir el negocio, por eso está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de productos para la tienda y para la tortillería, como aceite, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, maíz y leña, con esta nueva inversión ella considera que estará mejorando, generando mas rentabilidad al negocio y que sus clientes siempre demanden de sus productos.
Graciela considera que el préstamo anterior fue un gran aporte para el negocio, mejorando su condición y dándole más estabilidad.
texts.en:
Graciela has requested another loan so that she can restock her business. She will buy products such as cooking oil, rice, sugar, beans, corn and firewood to sell in her store and to use for the tortillas that she makes to sell. With this new investment she believes her business will improve because it will generate more profits in her business and she will meet the demands that her customers always have for her products. 

Graciela thinks the last loan was a great support to her business, helping improve her condition and giving her more stability.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, rice, sugar, beans, corn and firewood.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Damas Responsables, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador", es la ciudad cultural del país. Su bello paisaje urbanístico mantiene armonía con el entorno geográfico. Su centro histórico es el más grande y el mejor conservado del país  guarda encantadoramente las claves del pasado, allí se mezclan la gente, las flores, las artesanías: tejidos, bordados, cerámica, orfebrería, platería y sombreros de paja toquilla.,

La Señora María tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 5 años que estudian en la escuela. Su esposo es chofer y labora en su propio taxi, no tienen casa propia por la que viven en casa de un familiar.

Ella  se dedica a la venta de productos Naturales, actividad que la desempeñan hace tres años, ha comenzado con este trabajo para ayudar y mejorar la economía de su hogar y también porque le da tiempo para estar junto a su familia y cuidar de sus hijos. 

Esta repitiendo el crédito ya que necesita comprar más productos naturales de Ofnilife para seguir con su negocio. En el pago de su crédito anterior no tuvo ningún problema ya que realizo los pagos en las fechas indicadas, con las ganancias que obtuvo de dicho crédito pudo solventar muchos gastos de su hogar lo cual fue muy beneficioso para su familia. 

El banco comunal le gusta porque en cada reunión se encuentra con sus amigas y platican de varios temas de su interés y también le gustan las charlas de educación que reciben en cada reunión.

Su sueño es tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Ms. María is a member of the communal bank "Damas Responsables" [Responsible Ladies] and lives in the city of Cuenca, known as "the Athens of Ecuador," being the cultural city of Ecuador. Its beautiful urban landscape maintains harmony with the geographic surroundings. Its historic downtown is the largest and best preserved of the country, where keys to the past are enchantingly kept, and where people, flowers and handicrafts: weavings, embroidery, pottery, goldwork, silverwork and Panama hats, are interspersed.

Ms. María is 30 years old, married, and has two children, 8 and 5, who attend school. Her husband is a driver and works with his own taxi. They do not have their own home and so they live in a family member's house. 

She earns a living selling natural products, a business she has had for three years. She started doing this work in order to help and improve her household's economic situation and also because it gives her time to be with her family and care for her children. She is repeating the loan because she needs to purchase more natural products from Omnilife to keep up her business. She had no problems with paying off her previous loan since she made the payments by their due dates. 

Using the earnings she obtained from said loan she was able to cover many household expenses, which was highly beneficial to her family. She likes the communal bank because at each meeting she meets up with her friends and they chat on various topics that interest them. She also enjoys the educational talks they receive at each meeting. Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase natural products from Omnilife.

loans.name: Gemima

texts.es: Gemima, de 35 años, es una mujer amable y emprendedora, tiene muchos sueños e ilusiones que aun desea cumplir, es madre soltera de dos hijos, Romina de 15 y Camila de 9, a quienes cría desde muy pequeñas ella sola y es por quien día a día trabaja mucho ya que desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. EL trabajo de Gemima consiste en la venta de gelatinas, flan, arroz con leche y otros postres que son del gusto de sus múltiples clientes quienes se acercan a su puesto ubicado en un puerto cerca de la ciudad. Lleva realizando su trabajo por 6 años y en el transcurso del mismo aprendió cómo atender a sus clientes. Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que solo se dedica por medio tiempo y el resto del dia lo utiliza para poder estar en casa a lado de sus niñas a quienes tiene que apoyar mucho ya que se encuentran en edad que necesitan estar cerca de los sabios consejos de una madre. Cuando se inicio en su negocio solo era ayudante de una persona y a veces trabajaba por mucho tiempo recibiendo pocas ganancias. Desde entonces decidió emprender el trabajo sola y así tener sus propios ingresos,  espera seguir creciendo con lo que hace mas adelante poner un puesto en algún otro lugar de la ciudad. Este será el octavo cerdito con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero ya que le permitirá estar más tranquila y avanzar con sus planes de su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual y sobre todo compenetrarse mas con los integrantes de su banco comunal que son muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará ingredientes, insumos y materiales para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Gemima, 35 years old, is a friendly, entrepreneurial woman who has many dreams and hopes still to fulfil. She is a single mother with two children, Romina, 15 years old, and Camila, 9 years old. She has raised them alone since they were very young. She works hard day by day for them as she wants to offer them a better quality of life. Gemima's work consists in selling jellies, flans, rice puddings and other deserts which are enjoyed by her many customers. They come to her stall in a port close to the city. She has worked in this activity for six years and in this time she has learnt how to satisfy her customers. She enjoys her work a lot as she only works part time and the rest of the day she is able to be at home with her children. She has to support them as they are at an age when they need a mother's wise advice. 

When she started in this business she was only an assistant to someone and sometimes she had to work long hours to earn very little. Since then she decided to carry out this work alone and have a higher income. She hopes to continue growing in what she does and in the future be able to have another stall in a different part of the city.

This will be her 8th loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support which will allow her to be less worried and go ahead with her plans for her business. Furthermore, she is committed to paying her monthly quotas on time and above all empathize with the other members of her communal bank who are very supportive.

With the 3,000 PEN she will buy ingredients, supplies and material to continue her work.

loans.use: to buy supplies and utensils to continue with her work.

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
Percy de 26 años de edad convive con diana de 25 años, que fruto de esta relación tienen 1 hijo.
Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Llochegua. Percy es un hombre dedicado a la agricultura desde muy pequeño siempre ha estado insertado en esta actividad juntamente con sus queridos padres, pero ahora  trabaja con diana, su esposa, cultivando café. Su mayor anhelo de Percy es comprarse una vivienda por tal motivo es que trabaja con mucho ahíco para conseguirlo. Sin embargo se presenta algunas incomodidades como por ejemplo: la lluvia, que hace que el trabajo se le retrace, aun así Percy está contento y feliz con lo que realiza, por que gracias a la rentabilidad que le proporciona está progresando. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente sus cuotas. Percy está contento con su banco comunal por que son buenas personas. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles contratará peones para que lo ayuden a limpiar su parcela de café.
texts.en:
Percy is 26 years old and lives with Diana who is 25 years old. From this relationship they have a child.

They live in their own house located in the district of Llochegua. Percy has been devoted to agriculture since he was very young. He has always taken part in this activity together with his dear parents. Now, however, he works with Diana, his wife, growing coffee. Percy's biggest desire is to buy a property, and he is working hard to achieve this. However, he has to face some difficulties, for example: the rain, which delays his works. Despite this, Percy is happy and content with what he does, as thanks to the profitability provided he is progressing. 

This is his second loan with MFP. He is committed to paying his quotas on time.

Percy is happy with his communal bank as they are good people. With the 3,000 PEN he will hire labourers to help him clean his coffee plot.

loans.use: to hire labourers.

loans.name: Dalia Marisol

texts.es:
Dalia, está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para la compra de materiales para el negocio, ella considera que a través de los créditos ha mejorado y sus clientes siempre mantienen su preferencia, la inversión será en maíz, aceite, condimentos, chicharrón.
La condición de vida de Dalia ha cambiado en este periodo, ya que ahora vive en casa propia.
texts.en:
Dalia is requesting a new loan to buy materials for her business. She thinks that through the loans she has received she has improved. Her customers always maintain their loyalty to her. With the money from this loan she will buy corn, cooking oil, spices and pork rinds. 

Her living conditions have recently changed, she is now living in her own home.

loans.use: to buy corn, cooking oil, spices and pork rinds.

loans.name: Karoti Group

texts.en:
Dafrosa, who is in her early 40s, is married with four children who are still going to school.  She has had a food shop for 5 years now.  She works from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm daily and makes a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her 9th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to pay school fees, built a kitchen which was missing on her house, renovated the floor of her house,  replaced the missing items in the food shop and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to buy 50 kilos of sugar, 50 kilos of wheat flour, 20 kilos of backing flour, one big bucket of cooking oil, and a box of salt and biscuits.  Her dream is to one day be able to buy a land and build another house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Karoti", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy 50 kilos of sugar, 50 kilos of wheat flour, 20 kilos of backing flour, one big bucket of cooking oil and a box of salt and biscuits.

loans.name: Bujinlham

texts.en:
Bujinlham is a 52-year-old widow who lives with her daughter and grandchild in a Mongolian traditional felt tent – a ger - in an outer ger district without basic infrastructure of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia.  Her elder son lives alone in another ger in the same yard. 

Bujinlham has been operating a computer service business since 2006. She offers copying, scanning and printing service. Her monthly income amounts to approximately 500,000-650,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT). With the1,500,000 MNT Kiva loan she is planning to purchase one more computer and make some renovations to her business office.

loans.use: to purchase one more computer and make some renovations.

loans.name: Jaridini

texts.en:
Jaridini is 50 years old, married, and the mother of three children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling broiler chickens in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of about KES 28,000. 

This client was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers, and is applying for her first loan, for KES 30,000, to buy additional broilers to sell to her customers. 

Jaridini will use the profits made possible by this loan to assist in looking after her family. Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional broilers to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise is 45 years of age and married and with five children, aged 18,14, 8, 7 and 4. She has been selling clothes for the past five years and earns a monthly income of about KES 15,000.

She has requested a loan worth KES 15,000 to pay school fees. This is her first loan, and her dream is to own rental houses and to open a big wholesale shop.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia forma parte del Banco comunal “La Gula” perteneciente a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Ella se dedica a la preparación de comida rápida desde hace 10 años. Comenta que comenzó en el negocio vendiendo pasteles de La Ligua “comuna que se caracteriza por la fabricación de pasteles chilenos”. 
Actualmente se encuentra con la preparación de pastel de choclo, de acuerdo a la temporada de verano, comenta que su horario de trabajo es flexible, ya que prepara sus alimentos de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes. Por lo que vende desde su casa, afuera de los colegios y también afuera de las construcciones, para los trabajadores.
Además prepara, vende y entrega por encargo a los almacenes.
Su mercadería la compra en supermercados mayoristas en la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Con el crédito comprará un horno industrial, para hacer más eficiente su negocio con la cocción de sus alimentos. 
Una de sus metas para su negocio es tener un local establecido, ya que es sacrificado vender en las calles durante las temporadas de verano e invierno, por el exceso de calor y/o la lluvia. 
Cecilia vive junto a su marido, su hija de 13 años y un bisnieto de 4 años de edad. Sus sueños son brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que el grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte es muy bueno, organizado y comprometido. Además existe muy buena comunicación y confianza entre sus miembros. 
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a member of the “La Gula” communal bank, which belongs to the city of Valparaíso. She has worked preparing fast food for 10 years. She comments that she started the business selling pastries from La Ligua, "a town which is well-known for producing Chilean pastries."  

She is currently preparing pastel de choclo [a corn pie with a savory filling] for the summer season. She comments that her working hours are flexible, since she prepares her foods in response to orders from her customers. She sells them from her home, outside the schools and also outside construction sites, for the workers. 

She also prepares, sells and delivers to stores in response to orders. She buys her supplies from wholesale supermarkets in the city of Valparaíso.

With the loan, she will buy an industrial oven, to make her business more efficient with food preparation. One of her goals for her business is to have an established shop, since it is strenuous to sell in the streets during the summer and winter seasons, due to the excess heat and rain. 

Cecilia lives with her husband, her 13-year-old daughter and a great-grandson who is 4 years old. Her dreams are to provide a better quality of life for her family. 

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by the Esperanza Fund, since it will allow her to invest in her business. She comments that the communal bank group to which she belongs is very good, well-organized and committed. There is also very good communication and trust among the members. 
 
Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers northwest of Santiago. It is the regional capital and also the seat of the country's legislature. It is the nation's leading port, offering a great variety of beautiful and picturesque places, such as the home of poet Pablo Neruda, winner of the Nobel Prize.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven to make her business more efficient with food preparation.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is married and has seven children. They live in a five room house in Ntangang, a quarter in Mankon Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. Julie has faced challenges in life which include the death of her mother, theft and the death of her pigs, which caused a great loss to her business.

Julie will use this new loan to open a motor spare parts store in Yaoundé, the capital of Cameroon, where one of her children is based and will help at the store's counter. She is very positive that  her business will succeed and that the community will benefit from the availability of spare parts at all times without going long distances in search of parts.

Any profits from Julie's business will be used to educate her children, to build her house and to cater for other family needs. Julie says she prefers a loan from GHAPE because of installment payments and training in business management given to her by GHAPE. The group members and the centre have been very supportive during centre meetings, which also gives her courage to carry out her activities.

loans.use: to purchase motor  spare parts

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
Evalyne, 31 years old, is married and the mother of one child. For the last two years, she has earned a living by operating a cafe business. Evalyne earns a monthly profit of KES 15,000 and was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers. 

Evalyne is applying for her first loan, of KES 40,000, to buy additional plates, cups, serving dishes and food for her business. Evalyne will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her child's school fees. Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional plates, cups, serving dishes and food

loans.name: Lazaro Alberto

texts.es:
Lázaro, necesita realizar una compra, por eso solicita un nuevo préstamo, ya que desea comprar cerdos para el destazo, tambien comprara bambú para hacer canastos.
Él cree que con estos préstamos, lograra crecer en el mercado, darse a conocer a más clientes y crear un buen historial de créditos, que le permita mejorar las condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Lázaro needs to make a purchase, and for that reason he is requesting a new loan. He would like to buy pigs for butchering, and he will also buy bamboo to make baskets. 

He believes that with these loans he will be able to grow in the market, become known to more customers and create a good credit history, which will permit him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs for butchering.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience, 40 years old, is married,and lives in Air Port Community with her husband and children, aged between 11 and 16 and all in school. For six years, Patience has been selling rice, oil, pepper, and vita in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her aunt. Patience's major challenge is the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, and vita for her business. Patience's plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper and vita for her business

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala north region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, James has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, James has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities such as sugar for resale, and will help James to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. James hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

James is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which primarily serves small entrepreneurs like James who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities such as sugar

loans.name: Urtnasan

texts.en: Urtnasan lives with his wife and child in Central Mongolia. His wife helps with the business and his daughter is a high school student. Urtnasan started running an auto service in 2000. Since this type of service is really necessary in rural areas, the business is going really well. He is an experienced businessman and has a further plan to fix the cars by buying spare parts. Urtnasan is a talented guy who says that, "I want to extend the service by purchasing the spare parts of the cars." The total amount Urtnasan is requesting is 1,800,000 MNT for the spare parts.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie, 37 years old, lives in the community of Airport. She is a single mother of two children, aged 2 and 15, both of whom live at home and attend school. Mamie has been selling palm oil for nine years. She started this business with help from her father and learned this way of selling from her oldest sister. Mamie likes the way her business provides for her basics and is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane, 39 years old, is married and has three children. She has operated a grocery store business for 3 years and employs one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Jane has been able to grow her business. She hopes to be financially stable in the future. Jane has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy tomatoes, beans and potatoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, beans and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
He is married with four children.  They live in a four-bedroom house with one person per room at Mbomasa, a quarter in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced challenges in life such as deaths, sickness and accidents of family members.

He joined GHAPE in 2005 and has taken and successfully managed and repaid his loans four times with no major difficulties .He has been investing  his loan in a corn mill, grazing of animals and farming of crops. Given a new loan, he will expand his activities. He will buy more cattle, hire a herder who will take care of the cattle and buy seedlings for his farm. He strongly believes his business will succeed because he has a large piece of land where his animals can graze, the dropping will be used as manure for the farm products and he will buy a good breed of cattle. From this activity, the community will benefit from the droppings and from the sale of food crops like cassava, corn and beans, which he will harvest from the farm and sell to them at moderate prices. He will make sure the crops are available at all times.

The profit from the loan will be used for employment of more workers to work on the farm, for the education of his children, and for the addition of rooms to his house. He prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the low interest rate, the education they provide on loan management and marketing techniques given to him by GHAPE.

loans.use: to purchase cattle, hire a herder and buy seedlings

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir, 57 years old, is married and has three children. He has been growing fruits and vegetables in his garden for the last 10 years. He is a very experienced farmer and has deep knowledge of the land and how to operate it. Tahir was not able to find a job for several years and then decided to start his own business.  

Tahir usually raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them for profitable prices in the central bazaar. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand because people prefer to eat them every day and consider them very healthy. Also, one of the favorite national dishes is dolma, which is made of fresh eggplants, peppers and tomatoes. Tahir's monthly income from his business is 120 AZN, and it  is the only source of income for his family.

Tahir would now like to invest more capital in his business and purchase seeds and fertilizers. He has therefore applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN, which he hopes will improve his family's life. This will be Tahir's third loan and he has good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ixtiyar

texts.en:
Ixtiyar, 47 years old, is married and has three children. He has been growing fruits and vegetables in his garden for the last 10 years. He is a very experienced farmer and has deep knowledge of the land and how to operate it. 

Ixtiyar usually raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them for profitable prices in the central bazaar. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand because people prefer to eat them every day and consider them very healthy. Also, one of the favorite national dishes is dolma, which is made of fresh eggplants, peppers and tomatoes. Ixtiyar's monthly income from his business is 150 AZN, and it is the only source of income for his family.

Ixtiyar would now like to invest more capital in his business and purchase seeds and fertilizers. He has therefore applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN, which he hopes will improve his family's life. This will be Ixtiyar's third loan and he has good credit history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane, 36 years old, is married and has three children. She has operated a medical clinic for 10 years and employs two people. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Jane has been able to grow her business. She hopes to be financially stable in the future. Jane has applied for a loan of 50,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy medicine and a dental machine.

loans.use: To buy medicine and a dental machine

loans.name: Norjmoo

texts.en: Norjmaa is 52 years old and widowed. She lives with her three children in Uvurhangai province of Central Mongolia. She runs a pool service business in summer time and in winter times a construction materials business. She also runs s food cart. For her business, her daughters help her because she prefers not to hire and pay them. She plans to extend the business by opening a cook-shop so that she can keep the business normal and earn more for the three daughters. She is really a diligent woman who says, "I want to extend my business by opening my new cook-shop with support on the financial side". The total amount she is requesting is 250,000 MNT for the cooking equipment and the cooking materials.

loans.use: To purchase cooking equipment and cooking materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase equipment needed for her salon

loans.name: Hayfa

texts.en:
Hayfa is a Jordanian micro-entrepreneur. She is a 54-year-old widow woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan and a mother of one child.

Hayfa is doing handmade embroidery and is requesting a loan of 700 JD to purchase raw materials (ex. fabrics and string) with an aspiration of opening a shop.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as fabrics

loans.name: Mikhail

texts.en:
Mikhail was born in 1963 in Baku, Azerbaijan. After secondary school he finished a barber's course.  In 1988, he and his family moved to Kapan, Armenia, as refugees.   Mikhail, his wife and children have already become Armenian citizens.
 
Mikhail’s wife is a housewife, his daughter is married and lives separately, and his son helps Mikhail in his occupation.  Mikhail has a small room which he uses as a barber shop. He cuts adults’ hair and his son cuts children’s hair.  They work without days off until late in the evening. Thanks to their hard work they have many regular customers and thanks to the business they can support their family.

Mikhail is asking for a 210,000 AMD loan, which will allow him to buy a new mirror and couch for his barber shop's waiting room.

loans.use: buy a mirror and a couch

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 29 years old and married with two children. She runs a beauty salon to earn a living,  She has been in the business for 3 years and has employed one person. She also does poultry farming to earn extra income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a hair dryer machine and hair chemicals.

loans.use: buy a hair dryer and hair chemicals

loans.name: Naomie

texts.en: Naomie lives in Airport, she is 28 years old, single, and has four children between the ages of six and fourteen that are in school and live at home. For the past four years, she has been operating a shop (restaurant) where she sells food and drinks. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, charcoal, and drinks for her business. Her plans are to become a business manager and educate her children about business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, charcoal, and drinks for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy manure, pesticides, and better seeds.

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en: Teresiah is 49 years old, married and has 4 children. She sells goats to earn a living.  She has been in the business for 20 years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy more goats to sell.

loans.use: buy goats

loans.name: Baba

texts.en:
Baba is a 41-year-old married man with three children.  He is a farmer and has been raising fruits and vegetables for the last 9 years.  This is the main source of income for his family.

Raising and selling fresh fruits and vegetables brings stable income and is in high demand among the Azerbaijani people.  Fresh vegetables are good for national dishes like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are favorites for punch.  Baba usually sells his crops in the central bazaar and his profit per month is  300 AZN. 

Baba decided to expand his business. For this purpose, he has applied for a 1000 AZN loan.  He will buy seeds and fertilizers to increase his crops and cover his customers' demand.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Compressor Group

texts.en:
Zebedayo, who is in his late 20s, is married and has one small child.  He has been running two businesses, a motorcycle transport and a general store,  for two years now.  He works from 7:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Zebedayo's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to open a general store and to service his motorcycle and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He needs this loan to increase the general store stock and to take the motorcycle in for service.  His dream is to one day be able to buy a Bajaji.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Compressor", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: restock his store and service his motorcycle

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 30 years old and lives in the Airport Community. She is married with six children between three and fifteen years old, all of whom live at home and attend school. For the past ten years, she has been selling palm oil in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She enjoys the way customers respond to her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. In the future she wants to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Farac

texts.en:
Farac is a 41-year-old married man with two children.  He was unemployment for several years and to improve his situation he started a farming business 9 years ago. Now this is the main source of income for his family.

Raising and selling fresh fruits and vegetables brings stable income and is in high demand among the Azerbaijani people.  Fresh vegetables are good for national dishes like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are favorites for punch.  Farac usually sells his crops in the central bazaar and his profit per month is 300 AZN. 

Farac decided to expand his business. For this purpose, he applied for 1500 AZN in loan.  He will buy seeds and fertilizers to increase his crops and cover his customers' demand.  This is Farac's second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Zuleykha

texts.en:
Zuleykha is a 62-year-old woman on pension.  She is married and has two daughters.  She is a market vendor and sells different home products. She has 10 years of experience in this field, and is considered a knowledgeable and skilled person in her business.

The products she sells is very popular. Zuleykha is always friendly and polite with her customers, which makes her business successful. Her monthly profit is 120 AZN.  As this business is the only financial source for the family, Ramziyya's husband helps her with the business.  

Zuleykha  would like to expand her business and purchase more merchandise and diversify the range of product she sells.  For this purpose, she has applied for 1500 AZN.  She has already demonstrated herself as a good client with a positive credit history and this will be her sixth loan.

loans.use: buy home products to sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a farmer. She is married with four children aged 16,15, 8 and 6 years old. She is 39 years old and has practiced active farming for 16 years. Her farm currently produces milk, maize, and beans for the the local market. She earns additional income from her food vending business in the local market.

Faith has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy piglets for a venture into pig farming. She says the rate of production in pigs will help boost her farming income, improve her family's feeding needs, as well as provide income to educate her children. She had previously acquired two loans of 40,000 KES and 30,000 KES from Kiva.

She laments the high costs of feed during dry seasons, but adds she will remain loyal to Juhudi Kilimo to gain more from the available loan.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Nicodemus

texts.en:
Nicodemus is a resident of Murang'a in Central Kenya and has been farming for 40 years. He is 67 years old and married with six adult children. He produces milk and pigs for the local market. He gets additional income from his pension.

Nicodemus has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to increase the number of his piglets in his farming business. He says he will focus on exploiting the market for pigs. which is a new business and not yet fully exploited by many farmers in the area.

He is however concerned about the high costs of feed in the area.

loans.use: To buy piglets for his pig farming business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has been in farming in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya for 15 years and has been producing beans, potatoes and milk for the local market. She runs a retail shop in the local market to supplement her farming income.

Margaret has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says it will help her produce milk for family consumption as well as more income to meet other family needs. She is focusing on raising dairy goats too, in the future, for their high nutritional milk.

Margaret says unpredictable weather conditions are a challenge.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rauf

texts.en:
Rauf is a 32-year-old married man with one child.  He sells food products such as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages in his shop.  Aydin has 3 years of experience in this field, which makes him as knowledgeable and skilled person in his business.

The food product he sells is very popular among people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 300 AZN. His wife helps him to sell products in the shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of his good location, in the central bazaar of his home city.

Rauf would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital in his business. For this purpose, he applied for 1000 AZN to purchase and diversify  his foodstuff inventory.

loans.use: buy merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is 45 years of age.  She is married and has six children.  She has been in business for two years.  She generates a monthly income of KES 5,000.

Josephine will use the loan to pay school fees for her children.  With the income from the business, she will purchase more goods for her shop.   The anticipated profits will be used to support her family and business.  

This is her third loan with KADET LTD after successfully paying back the previous loans.  Her dream is to live a happy live and be able to give the best education to her children.

loans.use: pay school fees

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdalene is a 33-year-old a business lady.  She is married to Richard, a business man.  They are blessed with one child. She has been running a boutique as a primary business and a barber shop as a secondary business for the past four years, with a monthly income of KES 10,500. which she uses to support her family.

Magdalene is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  She will use the loan to buy new clothes and a shaving machine. 

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to open a beauty salon together with the barber shop, which will help her increase the living standard of her family.

loans.use: buy new clothes and a shaving machine.

loans.name: Gino

texts.es:
Gino forma parte del Banco comunal “La Gula” perteneciente a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
El se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente atiende una botillería, de la cual está a cargo desde hace 3 años. 
Comenta que el dueño del local fue su papá durante 35 años, sin embargo producto de una enfermedad el falleció, por lo que actualmente se hace cargo del negocio.
Su mercadería la compra a proveedores de bebidas, distribuidoras y también en viñas. 
Con el crédito comprará materiales de construcción, para seguir mejorando la infraestructura de su local.
Comenta que sus proyecciones son remodelarlo completamente, para surtirlo con nueva mercadería, además regulizará el servicio de teléfono publico, ya que le permitirá recibir otro ingreso económico. 
Cuenta que tiene una vitrina refrigerada con motor, por lo que aprovechará de invertir en nuevos productos, como alimentos y provisiones. 
Una de sus metas en su negocio es convertir su botillería en un minimarket.
Gino vive junto a su esposa, su hija de 8 años de edad y también junto a su madre. Sus sueños a nivel personal son estudiar algo relacionado con contabilidad empresarial.
El está muy agradecida de la ayuda brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá seguir invirtiendo en la remodelación de su local. El grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte es muy comprometido, lo cual lo mantiene motivado en seguir participando de la institución.
Por su parte las capacitaciones le han servido para aclarar algunas dudas en contabilidad. 
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
Gino is a member of “La Gula” communal bank, which belongs to the city of Valparaíso. He works in trade; specifically, he runs a bottle shop, which he has operated for 3 years. He comments that his father was the store owner for 35 years, however, he died of an illness, and now Gino has taken charge of the business. He buys his merchandise from beverage suppliers and distributors as well as from wineries. 

With the loan, he will buy construction materials in order to keep improving the infrastructure of his store. He comments that his plans are to renovate it completely, so that he can stock it with new merchandise. He will also set up a public telephone service, which will provide him with another source of income. He reports that he has a refrigerated display case run by a motor, which he will take advantage of to invest in new products, such as foods and snacks. One of his goals for his business is to convert his bottle shop into a mini-market. 

Gino lives with his wife, his 8-year-old daughter and also his mother. His dreams on a personal level are to study something related to business accounting. 

He is very grateful for the help provided by the Esperanza Fund, since it will allow him to keep investing in remodeling his store. The communal bank group he belongs to is very committed, which keeps him motivated to continue participation in the institution. For him personally, the training has helped him clear up some questions about accounting. 

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers northwest of Santiago. It is the regional capital and also the seat of the country's legislature. It is the nation's leading port, offering a great variety of beautiful and picturesque places, such as the home of poet Pablo Neruda, winner of the Nobel Prize.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to keep improving the infrastructure of his store.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.ru: Махмуд целеустремленный и трудолюбивый парень. Он холост и живет вместе с родителями и братом. Более 3-х лет Махмуд занимается купле- продажей сотовых телефонов. Он начал свой бизнес с предоставления компьютерных услуг. Он имеет 3 торговых  точек и старается расширить их. Махмуд хотел бы получить займ для дополнительного закупка товара. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Mahmud is a motivated and hard-working guy. He is single and lives with his parents and his brother. For over 3 years, Mahmud has been selling cellular phones. He began his business by offering computer services. He has three retail locations and is trying to expand them. Mahmud would like to receive a loan to purchase additional merchandise. He hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 43 years old, married and is a mother of four children.  For the last six years she has been earning a living by selling used clothes in Malindi and earns a monthly profit of KES 15,000. 

Agnes was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers.  She is applying for her second loan of KES 20,000 to buy additional clothing to sell to her customers. 

Agnes will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay her children's school fees.  Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she will have some financial stability.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Damari

texts.en:
Damari has been in farming for 10 years and currently employs one farmhand.  Her farm produces milk and vegetables for the local market. She is married and has 7 children who are all schooling.

Damari has requested a loan of 41,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow at 31,200 KES to boost her dairy farming and to build a dairy unit at 10,000 KES.  She aspires to rank among the major dairy suppliers in the market.

Damari is worried about the feed shortage, especially during the dry seasons.  She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's loan services.

loans.use: buy/insure a dairy cow and build a dairy unit

loans.name: Murman

texts.en:
Murman is 44 years old. He lives in the village of Mukhaestate, West Georgia. Murman is married and lives with his family: wife – Giuli, 17-year-old daughter, 6-year-old son, and mother-in-law (retired). Murman’s wife works as a cleaning lady and gets a monthly salary. Murman is a taxi driver. He has his own car and provides transportation service to the local population. Along with his main job, Murman is also involved in family farming activities. They own a corn farm and also a citrus garden with a total area of 0.4 hectare. The family sells the harvested products locally to greengrocery retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 650 Laris, including the monthly pension of Murman’s mother-in-law. 

Murman requested credit to change the fuel system in his car. He will install modern gas technology, which is more cost effective and will significantly decrease his cost for fuel. Consequently, his profit will increase and he will be able to spend more on family needs and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: change the fuel system in his taxi

loans.name: Sami

texts.en: Sami is a 31-year-old married man from Gaza.  He lives with his wife and five children. Three years ago Sami opened his own supermarket and now hopes that through this loan, he will be able to improve his business by expanding the size of his supermarket.

loans.use: expand his supermarket

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Исмоил добросовестный и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Более 15 лет он занимается скотоводством. Этим бизнесом он с детства знаком. Жена и сын помогают по бизнесу. Исмоил имеет еще дополнительный доход от продажи продуктов питания. Его магазин находится около дома. Исмоил хотел бы получить займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Ismoil is a conscientious and hard-working person. He is married and is raising three children. For over 15 year, Ismoil has been engaged in raising livestock - a business he has known since childhood. His wife and son help out with the business. Ismoil also has a secondary source of income from selling groceries at his store, which is located near his home. Ismoil would like to obtain a loan to purchase cattle and expand his business. He is looking forward to your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Isabella is 24 years old.  She is married to Anthony and the two are blessed with a three-year-old child.  She has been selling fish for the past five years and earns a monthly income of KES 14,000.  

This is her first loan, which will be used to buy more fish to sell.  The anticipated profit from her business will be invested back in to the business.  Her dream is to start transporting fish to Nairobi in the course of this year.

loans.use: by fish

loans.name: Karlygach

texts.ru: Карлыгач 24 года, замужем, растит годовалую дочку. Карлыгач с супругом занимается животноводством  и перепродажей сельхоз продукции. Скот один раз в неделю закупается на скотном рынке г. Кочкор (в расстоянии около 185 км), где проживают родители супруга. В будние дни Карлыгач продает мясные продукты на центральном базаре села Чуй, а по выходным дням – торгует скотом на скотском рынке.  Начав этот бизнес с суммы 3,000 сом (KGS),Карлыгач смогла развить его с ежемесячной прибылью в 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Карлыгач обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  110,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота. В ближайшее время, при помощи доходов от кредита, Карлыгач планирует увеличивать поголовье  скота, чтобы в будущем открыть свой магазин.
texts.en:
Karlygach is 24 years old, she is married and is raising a year-old daughter. Together with her husband, Karlygach raises livestock and sells products of agriculture. Livestock is purchased once a week at the animal market in the city of Kochkor (located 185 kilometers away), where her husband's parents live. During the week, Karlygach sells meat products at the central market of the Chui village, while on weekends she sells livestock at the animal market.

Having started her business with a sum of 3,000 som (KGS), Karlygach was successful in developing it so that it currently brings a monthly profit of 20,000 som (KGS). In order to continue expanding her business, Karlygach has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 110,000 som (KGS) to increase her product turnover. Using profits from this loan, Karlygach plans to continue increasing the size of her herd in the near future, and to open her own store later on.

loans.use: to increase product turnover

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice  is a mother of 7 children, aged between 25 and 5 years, with the last 4 still schooling.  She has been in farming for 10 years and now employs one farmhand.  Her farm produces maize, beans and vegetables. She also owns a cereals processing machine in the local market.

Loice has requested a loan of 57,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow.  She says this will improve her family's living standards.  She hopes to acquire more land to expand her farming business.  She however laments the high costs of farm inputs.

loans.use: buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Xaqani

texts.en:
Xaqani is 50 years old and a market vendor. He is married and has two children. 

Xaqani has been selling food items, beverages, toiletries, detergents, and clothes for the last four years. During these years Xaqani has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. He is a very friendly and polite person and has permanent clients who always come to Xaqani's shop to buy something. His wife helps him to sell products.

His monthly profit is 260 AZN and he would like to increase it. The most popular products he sells are butter, macaroni, cookies, and sugar, so he would like to take this direction and purchase more of them for his shop. For this purpose he applied for a 1,000 AZN loan.

loans.use: to buy more products for his market vending business to increase turnover.

loans.name: Razi

texts.en:
Razi is a 32 year old man and is single.  He is a market vendor and sells different kinds of food like macaroni, cookies, confectioneries, tinned food, tea and beverages like juices, soda and fizzy drinks. He has 5 years of experience in this field.  During these years Razi has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business.

Razi`s merchandise is very popular and brings him stable income of 300 AZN per month. The product that he sells is very popular and is used in everyday life. For instance tea is the beverage people drink the most with with cookies or candies. The demand is high and Razi wants to cover this demand. 

For this purpose he has applied for 1000 AZN to purchase and diversify into more foods and beverages items in his shop.

loans.use: to buy and diversify into more foods and beverages.
